text: This place has a lot of things going for it - it is just off the beaten path so that you can sit on the charming patio and it feels quiet and hidden.  And....they get the most important component of pizza right - the crust.  It's chewy and flavorful at the edges and thin in the middle while still standing up to the toppings and not getting floppy.  My only complaint is that they don't have a margherita pizza on the menu.  In my opinion, the margherita pizza is the true measure of a neopolitan style pizza restaurant, but Il Bosco does not offer one.  Their most simple pizza is this Adrianna, but instead of being dotted delicately with Buffalo mozzarella, it's spread liberally, American-style, with melted cheese.

Phenomenal pizza, quaint atmosphere, fresh ingredients. There was 2 of us, we ordered the Lucia and the Dona and inhaled both of them ! I'm from Chicago, and I have finally found pizza that can be called pizza !! Delicious crust, very friendly staff, excellent service, and tasty complimentary olives while you wait for your pizza .... can't wait to go back !!

Our favorite pizza place in town! We took local friends for their 1st time and they loved it! It was packed when we arrived at 7:30 but Barbara and Bill welcomed us with hugs and wine - we were seated within 10 min at a great table on the cozy patio- under strung party lights and outdoor heating - resting on pillows at our seats I told Bill the atmosphere is like heaven. We shared the kale and spinach and caprese salads before sampling a few of the specials pizza and my favorite, the Biaggia. We're all coming back, especially to see Arturo, the mystery guest- chances are he'll be there for your next visit too.

. We were in Phoenix last week and decided to try this place based on all the great Yelp reviews. I'm glad to say we were not disappointed. The pizzas are absolutely amazing. The owner runs this place himself and takes great pride in making sure that you are fully satisfied. The next time that we are in the Phoenix area we are definitely going going to have to make a return visit if I could I would give this place 6 stars

I just found this review saved as a draft from my trip to Scottsdale in March. I still feel just as strongly about it today...  I can honestly say that my meal at il bosco tonight was one of the best overall meals I've ever had. I can not think of a single thing I would change about this place, aside from putting it in my neighborhood at home in Denver. From the stellar service to absolutely delicious food to comfortable ambience they have truly done everything right. Trust me when I say that the reviews do not lie.

I went into Il Bosco for lunch and found that my party was the only group in the restaurant (okay, we were getting lunch at like 3 pm, which I guess is weird). This actually turned into a charming experience. We talked to the owner for a while and he told us the story of how he got his start.   He served us himself, and the food was fantastic! Super fresh, and we got to watch them make our pizza in the brick oven! We ordered the Biaggia pizza off the lunch menu, and it was topped with figs, prosciutto, cheese and arugula. Totally excellent combo! The Bistecca sandwich, with steak and mushrooms, was also good. Menu items were simple but fresh and clearly from high quality ingredients. I loved talking to the owner as well, it seems like this whole place was made with love!

I took my family of seven to IL Bosco's last night and was I ever happy I did. Coming from the Pizza capital of America, Connecticut, this restaurant would be one of the best against the nationally ranked pizza places there. My wife had the Fig, Goat cheese, Prosciutto and Arugula pizza,what a pie. I had the Lucia, and the kids had normal pepperoni, which they all raved over. You also have to have the Caprese salad, very, very good. The service was very friendly and informative. My only regret on the restaurant is that it's here in Arizona and not Connecticut. Well done.
Hard to find and very small but would go back many times. Great pizza and very friendly staff. Snug and cozy works well at this wonderful find.

Read such good things.  What a disappointment. Really? Five stars?  Maybe for attitude!  Paying for "still" water is really a joke when you are spending $27.00 on a bottle of wine  plus the cost of two pizza's - you would think water would be free.  If we were you we'd try Fate Brewing just down the street for a great wood-fired pizza and all the FREE "still" water you can drink without attitude.  Sorry, we only wish it was better as it's just out our back door.  Best of luck to Bill.
I've tried every pizza place in the area and this is By far the best place to get pizza in Scottsdale.  They use only the best ingredients on their pizza.  Also have excellent root beer.

Very solid pizza with great atmosphere!  Low key, friendly, and all about excellent pizza with fresh ingredients.  I knew as soon as I saw the brick oven and the simple wine glass that I was in the right place.  Just wish I found it sooner

This hidden gem offers delicious food with an authentic Italian ambiance. The menu is simple, yet incredibly flavorful. The ingredients are fresh and the wood fired pizza oven cooks everything to perfection!

Well, we were swayed by the reviews and good press, so we went.  Not overly impressed, but I guess it is in what one is looking for.  This place has one size pizza, 11 inch, and a pizza variety limited to eight or so.  None are standard Italian fare.  Salads are limited to two pretty ordinary selections.  Our pizza was VERY salty, with a remarkable blandness.  My wife, who has a very limited capacity for pizza was still hungry after we split a salad and a pizza.  Also, beware ordering the $3 bottle of water.  It is very large but non-branded.  Folks who like this type of pizza are those taken with botique kinds of food given a liking for something non-traditional.   Pizza Bianco folks would be happy with this as would Barrio Mexican food fans.  For us, these offerings were lacking in flavor, spice and quantity.  I'm sure the quality of ingredients is good as the proprietor seems to take great care with his product.  However, in the final analysis, we cannot agree with any 5 star rating.  PS.  The owner responded to my comments saying he was happy to be compared to Pizza Bianco and Barrio.  I wasn't suggesting those spots were bad.  However, what they offer is  "Foofey Food."   If that is the kind of fare one likes, so be it.  For those looking for something more substantial, "Foofey Food" doesn't do the trick.

We were introduced to Il Bosco by a very close friend who is a chef. Looking through their Yelp reviews and website I saw that they also cater! Our first dinner was fabulous and I knew I wanted them to cater my upcoming wedding. Their pizza is delicious, ambiance is great, and staff are so friendly. Bill made the process so easy and their catering prices are fantastic. My guests LOVED pizza at the wedding. Who wouldn't like fresh pizza at a wedding?! With the pizza oven parked in my driveway, they did passed appetizers, salad, pizza, and cannoli for desert. This was the best decision I made for my wedding. Out with cold catered chicken piccata and in with IL BOSCO!!!

I found Il Bosco on Yelp and came because it had so many 5 star ratings. It's for good reason this little hole in the wall has garnered such positive remarks.  First thing: it's tough to find, but don't give up. The restaurant can be found behind their portable wood fire pizza oven. Once inside, wave to the owner. He's wearing a white chef coat and has grey hair. Even if you don't wave, count on a table side visit.   Second: he's a former golf pro who tired of traveling and thought opening a restaurant would be fun.   Third: get the homemade meatballs to start. Delicious and served on a plate of homemade tomato sauce that's also delicious.  Fourth: order the Joanna or Biaggia. Every pie comes in just one size. The Joanna has hot Italian sausage that's home made. The Biaggia is the PERFECT combination of sweet and savory. Yes, it has figs in it and yes, they are delicious.   Fifth: be prepared to come home with money in your pocket because Il Bosco is very affordable.  I brought two buddies from SoCal and all agreed we would return. Lots of people talk about Pizzaria Bianco, and for good reason. Il Bosco is right there in terms of food quality but you don't have to wait four hours. It's the PERFECT local Pizzaria.

As close as it gets to a real Italian pizza here in Phoenix. I am an Italian and I have only been here for a few years, and let me tell you, it is refreshing to finally get a taste of home. The crust is just the consistency that it should be. It's not an American pizza, it's much lighter and not as greasy. I will most definitely return on a regular basis.
Recently moved from the East Coast. So glad Yelp introduced us to Il Bosco. I highly recommend the Biaggia pizza. It's amazing. Great food and great hospitality from this small little spot.

David P.   You're sub part review is nonsense.  The owner is the most hospitable owner we have ever encountered !   Just a great environment and friendly people.  We chose to sit at bar and watch all the pizzas being made in the brick oven.  It made us change our mind 4 times in which one to choose!!   We had the special app of stuffed peppers and the spinach & kale ceased salad. Both amazing!  And then the owner asked us to taste the salsa di parmigiana with his homemade crostini, compliments of the house. Wow!!  Now my wife and I are enjoying and Italian beer and Italian wine, both great, while we decide what pizza to order.   We frequent the foodie town of Austin often and this place would kill there !!

After reading reviews on Yelp, we left a different pizza place to come here.  I'm glad we did.  The pizza was fantastic; I could have stayed there and watched them make pizza for hours.  The wood fire oven is right there and watching them work is inspiring.  The owner, Bill Forrest, was there and took our order.  It was so nice to see an owner go and visit with the patrons, calling most of them by name, to make sure people were happy with their experience.   Bill cares...about the food they make and about the people who visit.  What a great combination.  I love to eat quality food.  I don't exercise like a should, so I do my best to have a healthy diet because I still have an active lifestyle.  I have become passionate about food, usually preferring to make/grow my own food.    Some day, when I get "20 seconds of crazy insane courage," I will follow Bill's example and do things the right way...the way he does it at Il Bosco Pizza.
Great pizza!! One of the best pizza places in AZ. Very convenient location near Scottsdale and Shea. So good!

Came here based on the reviews and this place exceeded my expectation. The service was excellent; we took the suggestions of our server, who I think could be the owner. We shared three pizzas between the 4 of us and it was the perfect amount of food. The biaggia was our number one and is also a house favorite. Do not leave this place without a pour of the after dinner amaretto!
The best pizza we've ever had. Incredible service...they make you feel very welcome. Beautiful patio. We'll be back again very soon!

Came here late night after a day of hiking and exploring. First of all, I would have given this place 4 stars because the food did not live up to the rating based off yelp. I came here with high expectations, and I was with my family. The kids wanted ice cream, the waiter recommended us a lemon sorbet but did not state the price, and since the menu lists a sorbet a certain price we thought it would be the same price we would be charged. Turns out, they were very misleading (minus one star) and we were charged almost 2x as much..I believe it was $7 for half a lemon sized sorbet! Outrageous, esp when we got three of them! Total of three of the sorbets cost the same as one pizza. Pizza is overpriced also, esp since their toppings aren't that much. Disappointed as they did not meet the expectations as I thought they would based on the yelp review.
This place was a little tricky for us to find, but we weren't disappointed! Great food and awesome customer service! Make sure you get the fried raviolis, they were amazing!!!!

Eager staff, like they are on a mission to serve.  Quiet and cozy place.  Not what you want for a first date if you need a little energy from the enviro.  Well-crafted za, and baked by a guy watching the flecks of dough cook to perfection.  Their idea of perfection looks a little dark, so you should like a slight charring.  The prosciutto ingredient is the real thing.  The crust is lean.  It seems like flour, water, yeast, salt - no or little shortening.  This is not the golden pie where your hand comes away greasy after grabbing a slice.  Excellent salad - fresh romaine, good sharp cheese.  If you don't like a healthy dose of dressing ask for them to lighten up, but the caesar - it's tasty!  Interesting selection of italian wines at $8-10 for a small-med pour.  This is an artisan's pizza and deserves a try to round out the rich, cheesy pies that are found elsewhere.

Make sure you make your way here! Great service, incredible food, and very Mom & Pop feel. The meatball appetizer was delicious, and can't go wrong with any of the pizzas here. I would definitely come back here, and soon!

Great pizza and friendly service. We had tr biaggia (goat cheese, fig, prosciutto, arugula, and parm) and the Dona (fresh tomato, pancetta, and cheese) - both were great. The crust is crisp with a great chew and good flavor. We also tried the meatballs which are small but flavorful with a touch of fennel for extra flavor. The fried ravioli is a far cry from the fried ravioli you're probably used to and definitely worth a try. I will definitely be back.
We are foodies from Portland Oregon. We saw a positive review so we gave this restaurant to try. It was excellent! We had a Caesar salad and a margarita pizza. They were delicious!

This is my favorite pizza place in the area. It's a cute little restaurant where the owner actually cares to stop and have a conversation with you. I get take out from here often and the pizza is always fresh and never disappoints. Best place in the area!

We ate there a few nights ago with our kids and it really was perfect. The atmosphere is charming, our server was fantastic, and the pizzas were exceptional!  Such a special and wonderful place. Hope to go every time we are in Scottsdale.
The food is EXCELLENT!  We have been 5 times now, and everything we have had has been delicious!  We will continue to dine w Bill and IL Bosco!  The Caprese is AWESOME!
romantic atmosphere, all the food was perfectly handmade and rustic.

Pizzas are amazing but much of everything else on the menu is not all that great.  Example:  my salad consisted of wilted, slimy, and old lettuce.  The replacement dish that the waiter brought to me was no better.  However, the waiter took the salad off the bill so at least the customer service is up to par.  Again, pizzas are unique and delicious.  I would go back for the pizza.

We're from Northern California, so finding good pizza is almost a mission for us. We drove 15 miles to find Il Bosco, and the food did not disappoint. The outdoor patio seating was a nice bonus. Do be aware that in Scottsdale, most restaurants button up tight at 9 pm, so be sure to allow enough time to order and eat before closing. We arrived at 8:15 and got a chilly reception. The person waiting on us splashed the wine into our glasses and I ended up with some on my jeans. Plates and dishes were removed without asking before we had finished eating. Since others on Yelp have praised the service, we're chalking up our experience to our poor timing.

Can't say enough about my meal here. From start to finish it was a pleasant, enjoyable dining experience. Friendly, attentive service and delicious food. Three of us shared a bottle of wine, caprese salad, Biaggio and Carmela pizzas, and a taste of their homemade amaretto. Wonderful homemade crust and top notch toppings make Il Bosco a special place. They seem to do a brisk carry-out business, too. They also have a portable wood-fired oven to do catering. Wish I lived here so I could be a regular!
We have been here 4 times now and have never been disappointed. Small bar so we try to sit there. Great owner, a taste of homemade Amoretto for desert.  Pizza is awesome. We'll be back!
Our new favorite place for pizza! Friendly staff, fresh ingredients and great service.

This place is great! I went there with my mom and my sister. We figured we would order two pizzas and take the rest home as leftovers. Well, the pizzas came and we ate every last bite! So much for those leftovers!   After dinner we had the brownie sundae, which was also to die for. We loved this quaint restaurant and their friendly staff. The owner is so welcoming and pleasant. Thanks for the amazing meal!

Visiting from California and Bill was the ultimate host and the food was excellent. Salads were fresh and awesome. Pizzas were crisp and inventive.  The wine was delicious and very reasonably priced (and served at the correct temperature to boot). It's a great little space in a city full of cookie-cutter restaurants, this is a unique gem.  I recommend it highly.

My husband and I ordered the Joanna and the Donna for dinner tonight.  Because we had such a great pizza a few weeks ago we wanted to try it again. BIG MISTAKE.  We each had one slice and threw the rest  out.  Didn't taste like pizza and the  crust was not done at all.  One of the pizzas was so bad we were afraid to eat anymore of it, nothing tasted right, didn't even smell right.  When we called to complain and let them know about the pizzas we were met with " well we haven't had any complaints tonight and I'm sure when you come back in you will find it better". No offer of free pizza and no apology.  Never going back, too bad, we like supporting local small business.

Il bosco reminded me of a pizza place on lago lugano in switzerland.  The owner is very laid back and generous; he even bought me a "campari" soda.  It's obvious he has a lot of passion in his restaurant.  The ambiance is intimate and the staff is attentive and on their game.  The flavor from the wood fire oven was as expected.  The pizza dough was over kneaded...also, if the portion of bread/crust was less I think I would have been more pleased.  The ingredients seemed fresh but average quality.  The amount of cheese and sauce was perfect though...  I'm honestly unsure if I'll return.  My expectations were higher.  Still, give it a try if you want a decent pizza with great service and atmosphere!

Stopped at Il Bosco after seeing a story about it on TV.  It was great!  We had a brunch pizza with chorizo, topped with an egg, then a pizza with sausage and spinach.  Both were really good!  We sat at the counter and watched the pizzas being made.  The cooks and hostess were all so nice.  It was a fun, unique, out of the way place--we will definitely stop in again on our next vacation!

This place is always fantastic and there is always something unique available to try on a regular basis (the daily pizza white/red specials are always fantastic!)  That said, this truly is a special place beyond the amazing pizza (and bread and olives and wine and....) and it's a result of the special attention that the proprietor Bill Forest gives to each and every customer that has the privilege of dining here.   My fiance and I try to go 2-3 times a month or more (we'd go 2x a week if we lived closer) and we're never ever disappointed, in fact, there is no other pizza that we will even eat now that we've found il Bosco.   Always fantastic, always personal, always amazing, I cannot recommend this place enough and implore anyone who's interested in pizza to visit here.

YUMMY!!!  My husband and I had a delicious lunch today on the patio.  We shared a salad and 2 pizzas.  The owner Bill had us try this pizza that was AMAZING!  The salad was yummy too :)    We will definitely be coming back again!  A hidden gem right off of Scottsdale Rd and Shea  LOVED THIS PLACE!!!

Tried it out on 7/3/12 with my husband and 2 friends. We each ordered a different pizza so we got to try a nice variety. Loved the pizza especially the crispy crust. Very fresh ingredients. There is no reason to drive into Phoenix for pizza at Bianco or Cibo when this gem is in the neighborhood! I will be back.

The best wood fire pizza I have ever eaten.  Good variety, indoor and outdoor seating.  Owner came by our table to ask about the meal.  Decent beer selection (local).  The charge of a couple bucks for tap water is something that the owner needs to reconsider, leaves a bad taste after a great meal.  Upcharge something else to make up for this.  Otherwise great pizza.
Awesomeness. Came from out of town and this place crushed it. Great service. Fantastic food. We'll be back for sure!
Great wood fired pizza. Appropriately chilled wine. Fresh organic ingredients. Delightful conversation with the owner.

This is a bold statement you can only make once in your life, but this is best pizza I've ever had.  Eaten there twice in 4 days. You taste the freshness of ingredients with every bite & dough is so fresh it doesn't stay in stomach making you feel gross & like you have pizza hangover. Also try the meatballs - exceptional. Owner is cool guy trying to take a swing at his passion - have to respect an entrepreneur following his passion.

Wonderful little spot where you could blink and miss it if you don't know where you're going.  Pizza's are as authentic a Neapolitan style as you will get in Arizona.  Small, simple menu that won't overwhelm, great service, cozy atmosphere...... Worth the trip!
Went to Il Bosco last night for the first time and was not disappointed!  The Joanna pizza was delicious.  Can't wait to go back and try the other pizzas :)

We have been here twice now and love everything about it! The owner is very passionate and involved in his restaurant. He was serving customers, busing tables, and even sat down to have a conversation with us. The brick oven pizza is excellent! We also had the fried ravioli, which was a special of the night and the house made red sauce that came with it was the real deal. Beautiful property.. Would definitely recommend this place.

I've been waiting too long to write reviews, so all I can tell you is that the food is quite good. It's four stars. If you want the best, go to Pomo in Phoenix, Piazza al Forno in Glendale, and maybe Bianco.  The owner didn't think I was legit when I walked in. I came in for a late lunch, as usual, well after 1:00. It was quiet, might have had the whole place to myself. When I walked in, the owner did some kind of read on me and pegged me as someone who might be looking for a random pizza place, might not appreciate the kind of primo place this was. Picture a Mexican dude walking in in khaki shorts, polo shirt, nice sandals. Call it a graduate student uniform, or an Arizona uniform, but maybe it's a big departure from the normal North Scottsdale lunch crowd.  Anyway, I sensed the vibe come from him -- he thought I didn't know what kind of place this was. So we were talking, and I mentioned that I'd been to Bianco and Humble Pie, that I took Alan Richman's Top 25 pizza places in America and used it as a guide for my trip through the northeast (try Bob and Timmy's in Providence, RI -- they grill their pizza, man). From this, it seemed like he understood that I was a serious individual, someone who was there for the real thing.

WOW ...  some on Yelp feel  there is a controversy about the quality of pizza at Ill Bosco?  You have to be kidding me ...  I challenge anyone in a very loving way  to take a drive out to this very centrally located location (Shea and Scottsdale rd) and sit down and try one of the pies.  Bill is not only a wonderful host, but the food is consistently superb and the overall energy (especially at night) is incredible.  I was there with my husband last friday night and it had the feel of a booming New York restaurant on a busy night.  Best of all ... you won't be paying New York prices, because everything is reasonable.
Great place. Pizza and dessert were both amazing.  The atmosphere and staff were very homey and inviting. We will be going back.
Great place for great pizza done right. The owner is always on site and the service is spot on.

Il Bosco is an excellent little restaurant and pizzeria.   warm, fun decor.  the food is fantastic.   the food on the menu is fresh and creative.  the owner, Bill Forrest, has a very personal touch and oversees it all quite well.  it is a hidden gem in Scottsdale but once you know where it is you will go back again and again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I'd heard about Il Bosco from Yelp, was in the area, and thought I would try some of their pizza.  It is very small, with a small outside seating area.  The menu has pizza, salads, two appetizers, and two desserts.  They have a wood fired pizza oven, which gives their pizza the perfect crust. They do have beer and wine, although a limited selection.  I ordered the Joanna Pizza - pepperoni, sausage, cheese and tomatoes, and had them add onions. It was delicious, one of the best pizza's I have tasted.  I was going to give it a four star rating, but had several pieces left over, which I took home for breakfast the next day.  Wow!! It is the only pizza I have had that actually tasted better the day after!! That in and of itself, bumps them up to a five star rating.  Another plus is their prices are very, very reasonable.  All in all, a great little restaurant.

Just awesome. Had the Biaagia and I was blown away by it's flavor and how crunch, yet chewy the pie crust was. They don't get cheap with their ingredients and offer the toppings generously. Nice fresh meat and vegetables.  Friendly staff, every time I come here.  Try the Caprese. It's incredibly fresh and delicious.

I'm new to the area, so I've been slowly trying local pizza places trying to find my new favourite pizza.  This was the worst one so far.  I ordered through DoorDash.com, which was a disaster unto itself.  I can't blame Il Bosco for the fact that my pizza arrived cold. What I can blame them for though, is that the pizza was inedible because it tasted like a salt lick.    My Order - The Adrianna (cheese, tomato sauce, basil)  I have had some bad pizza in my day, but I can always power through, because even bad pizza is usually has some redeeming quality.  This, however, I had to throw out.  It was burnt in places (I know wood fire pizza is going to have some char marks, but this was flat out burnt).  I would have been willing to deal with the burnt parts, but it was so salty I couldn't choke it down.  Believe me, I like salt - I add it to everything. If I'm saying it was too salty, it's because it tasted like someone dropped the entire jar of Morton's in the sauce, then tried to hide the spill with the cheese.    Perhaps dining in would yield a better pie, I don't know.  It would take a lot of me to take the risk though.

This East Coast girl was a very happy camper after our visit to Il Bosco! (we have high pizza standards where I come from).  We were group of 5 in town on business. Our original plan was Romo, but the 1-1/2 hour wait deterred us and we found Il Bosco and what a find it was! The atmosphere was comfortable and casual. The owner was very attentive with a great sense of humor. All good, but nothing compared to the quality of the food. From the delicious olives and bread with seasoned olive oil that got us started, to the fresh salad and finally to four of the best pizzas! We tried white and red; all had perfectly thin crusts with the right amount of dough around the edge and each was topped with wonderfully fresh cheese or other inventive ingredients. Exquisite!  The party didn't end there - we finished off with lemon sorbetto which just perfect and the youngest members of our group had the stamina for the pumpkin brownie.  We all decided when we left dinner that this place was going to get a return visit on our next business trip.

We  came here and were so excited to see Forrest but when we drive up we. See they. Are closed august he closed for the month of August.so hopefully they will open  After aug. Looking forward to pizza making

We're staying nearby at the Hyatt Regency for a weekend getaway and wanted a change of scene with a small local restaurant that would appeal to me, my husband, and 5-year-old son--and weren't disappointed with this choice.  We sat outside on a pleasant evening and enjoyed a couple of pizzas, Caesar salad, wine, and gelato. Pizza was nicely crusty and slightly charred at the edges. Staff was kind, vibe was good, a winner all around.
I searched on Yelp for "best pizza in Scottsdale", and this came up #1.  I thought it was great.  The service was wonderful.  The pizza was great, probably thanks to the wood oven.

I'm seriously wondering about all of the "5 star" rave reviews here. I went to il bosco last weekend with a couple of friends.  We sat at the bar right in front of the pizza oven.  The first thing I noticed was a giant bag of pre-shredded mozzarella cheese sitting on the counter. For an authentic Neopolitan-style brick oven pizza place that is unacceptable. As expected the pizza tasted like it was made with processed cheese.   The sauce and mozzarella just melted into a big gooey mess in the center and the crust was pretty dry and flavorless.  This pizza is average at best. I was really disappointed in this place, especially after some reviewers compared it to Bianco's, Cibo and Pomo.  Hate to say it, but il bosco isn't close to being in the same league as those places.  If I didn't know better I would suspect most of these reviews are the usual friends and family pump-up.

Have loved this restaurant since the first time I ever ate here. I own a salon in the area and can say that Il Bosco is responsible for feeding us multiple days out of the week. Love the changing specials and charm of the quaint atmosphere. Staff is friendly and accommodating, but not overly intrusive. Love the caprese panini and the biaggo pizza! All the food is extremely fresh and always tasty.

My wife and I love this place. The pizzas are cooked perfectly and topped with creative and very tasty toppings. Each one has a story.  Ask the owner. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Our new favorite place!

Great hidden gem. Delicious wood oven cooked pizzas. Nice, small lunch menu and very fair prices, about $7-$8 for a lunch sized 8 inch pizza.   To add to experience, the owner and staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming.   Well worth a visit.
The pizza is very cheesy and delicious. Their sodas are just fresh and amazing. The owner Bill is very nice. The whole place is very comforting. If possible, I would rate this place 933 stars!!!!!
Amazing Pizza!  We ordered 8 pizza's and there was not a slice left.  Even the kids had great things to say.  The service was awesome.  When we are back in Scottsdale we will definitely be back!

Delicious! Everything!! Pizza, salad, wine, olives & people! Wood fired pizza wedding was perfect from start to finish and would highly highly recommend! Owner Bill Forest made us feel like family so, of course, anniversaries will be celebrated here too! If you're looking for that JUST right feel & flavor for your big event .... il bosco!
Food was great but what happened?! Service started off amazing then plummeted. No matter how the food is, it's not worth being treated like that. Will never be going back.

I live in Chicago. I've visited Rome. I don't dream about places like I do Il Bosco. I'm not a chit-chatty person, but I always find myself wanting to talk to the owner. Everyone that works here makes the experience impeccable. You really can't go wrong with any pizza here, my favorite is probably the Carmela. Also, if you ask the owner he'll make this salsa cheese dip (pictured in my photos. Please go out of your way and ask, he makes it and is never annoyed with the request. This is hands down the best place in all of Phoenix/Scottsdale for pizza and I feel strongly about that statement.

Super sweet and attentive (without being overly attentive) service and fabulous food - we had the caprese, kale caesar and the kids had plain pepperoni pizza - we had the sausage and onion (dee-lish)!  And the beers were amazing! Pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this restaurant was.  Outdoor seating was the perfect temperature at 6pm-ish in April!

Excellent food. Very small seating area and eccentric owner, but this actually makes the experience so unique. Not your run-of-the-mill pizza place. Very authentic brick oven pizza. I go often with my family.

Some of the best homemade family-style pizza you could ask for is right here in the heart of Scottsdale.  Everything here is made with extreme attention to detail and the staff exudes this sense of family and graciousness in everything they make. Truly a mom and pop restaurant that's worth visiting again and again.   Don't forget to ask for their amazing crème brûlée from their dessert menu, this stuff blows franchise restaurant Crème brûlée's  out of the water and then top it with fresh fruit of the day.

After scouring the United States to find the best pies, I would go on a limb to say that Il Bosco is within the Top 5 Pizzerias in the Nation! The sauce, the cheese, the quality of the toppings, and, most notably the crust, are all exactly what you'd expect from a proper thin crust pizza. If you live in the Phoenix area, don't eat pizza from any other restaurant until you get your butt to Scottsdale to try this place out. If you're visiting Phoenix from somewhere else, you need to try out this joint. It's truly a hidden gem.

Delicious find that we discovered after tailing a pizza oven on wheels (turned out Il Bosco was catering an event in our neighborhood). Start g from the fabulous in-house brined olives to the delectable bread to the fabulous roasted rappinni & garlic to the cheese salsa the the amazing pizzas, this place in an undiscovered scottsdale treasure! Just remember it is closed in the month of July, so get there soon!

Who said that a great pizza has to be done with imported ingredients? California grown tomatoes, and local ingredients make this an amazing Italian style pizza. Checked by an a Italian born and raised in Italy now living in New York

Best pizza I've had since I moved to Phoenix six years ago. Super friendly staff very friendly and the best part of it all is it is family owned. In addition to the pizza we had the caprese which was delicious and the creme brûlée. Definitely a must if in the area!

Open for lunch! My first time here I want with a group of girls from the office. Upon walking in the place is super cozy and welcoming. The owner greeted us right away. He began telling us about the restaurant and gave us great suggestions about what to order.  We had two pizzas and a sandwich to share. The steak sandwich was ridiculously good! The pizzas were just the right size for one person and the crust was awesome. The homemade olives are so good as well! They even have unique sodas in glass bottles. I am loving this place and the price for lunch is great too!  You have to check out this hidden gem, but don't take my seat!

It is not often that you run across a hidden gem such as this during the weekly business travels.  Today I did just that.  I stumbled into Il Bosco Pizza in Scottsdale, AZ.  I was greeted at the door by the owner/ Bill Forrest.  I received nothing but wonderful hospitality throughout my dining experience from both Bill and Barbara as well as some entertaining dialog with the kitchen team (a penquin tattoo, really?). The wine list was well thought out with very reasonable by the glass and bottle prices.  The menu selection was focused.  By that I mean, it stayed true to what they do and they do it well.  Too often you find the restaurant that wants to be everything to everybody.  Not here.  They do pizza very well.  I have traveled to Italy many times in my career and this place nails it.  Great dough coupled with the finest of ingredients, prepared in a minimalist style that lets the food do the talking.  I am truly impressed.  I will be back often.  I hope for Bill and Barbara that this is a hit but deep down I love the hidden gem.   If you are a foodie and love food without pretense, you will love Il Bosco.  This is a foodie find.  I am a chef and I absolutely love this place.  You will not be disappointed.   Cheers,

Weather was beautiful so we sat outside.  Great service and the pizza was very flavorful.  The restaurants uses quality ingredients from the organic flour, simple yet tasteful tomatoes for the sauce, and olive oil.   The pizzas are simple yet packed with flavor.  Will definitely be back.

We will absolutely be going back! I had the patate pizza, my son had the mussels  and my husband had a pizza that had sausage and peppers on it (sorry I can't remember the name of that one). Seriously good food, all the way around. Normally we are Pita Jungle nuts and we will always love that place, too -- but now there's a wonderful alternative next door. GREAT JOB GUYS!

This was our second time eating here, but it will definitely not be our last!  We had the pizza again, and it was excellent.  This place also has Italian beers and craft sodas.    It's a nice, welcoming divey place, where you really feel comfortable.  And the prices are very reasonable, especially for such premium wood-fired pizza.
Great service, great spot and great pizza. Fresh ingredients, the real deal oven, the professional service. I went for lunch, but will definitely come back for dinner.

Saturday afternoon. Went in with a party of 5. Actually, you know what, I'm just going to cut to the chase. The entire party thought the service was surprisingly rude and the pizzas were all incredibly salty.  The dessert spumoni (why did we bother), was an over frozen artificial tasting chocolate covered block of ice cream.   Maybe a bad day for the business, but a terrible experience for me.

The pizza is awesome. Its like a Neapolitan -- smaller round with a softer crust. We also had their seasonal vegetables, which were roasted brussel sprouts with burrata and balsamic. To drink We had prosecco and Moretti on tap. We were very pleased with everything, from food to service to ambiance (reggae playlist, ftw). I hope to visit again soon. Thanks!
Quickly becoming a favorite spot. Nice patio, great pizza! My favorite is the Gisella - pepperoni and jalapeño.

Pizza  is amazing! Elana Pizza is the perfect balance of sweet savory and salt. Definitely a must try. Meatballs are better than my Nona's and best I've had. Menu is compact but everything is excellent!!!
Great fun pizzas. Good wine. Would give 5 stars if service was better to ask about a second glass!

I have now eaten here several times and the service as well as the food has been top notch. I only wish they had a slightly more diverse menu, but that is not a deal killer for us. We love their pizza and my wife enjoys several of the other dishes. I nice find in Scottsdale that I highly recommend for anyone looking to dine in a nice comfy Italian bistro style restaurant. Great job guys!!!

We ordered take-out from Il Bosco last night and was extremely pleased with the food but also the service. I wasn't expecting much since it was almost closing time and from my experience with other places is that the employees usually want to get out of there so theres attitude or a sense of being rushed to get me out the door, but when I arrived to pick up my order, the owned greeted me with such a cool calm and collected demeanor which  was such a pleasure, he even helped me carry my food and walked me out to my car. The place itself had a great atmosphere, I can see myself and my husband coming back to eat in next time! I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family!

Seasoned Phoenix/Scottsdale area diners know the usuals when it comes to great pizza: Bianco, Cibo, Pomo....Il Bosco deserves to join that list.   They serve pizza cooked in a wood-burning oven. Each pie (only one size here) spends about 90 seconds to two minutes in the oven. The result is fantastic. What separates great pizza from good? The crust. And the crust at Il Bosco is the right combination of the three Cs: char, crisp and chew that you can only achieve with an extremely hot pizza oven. If you judge your pizza on the crust, first and foremost, as I do, you'll love this place.  Of course, pizza is more than simply great crust. Pizza varieties, all named after women, should be enough to please everyone. Il Bosco offers a good variety of red and white pies. I didn't try any of the white pies yet, but they looked very good. I can heartily recommend the following red pies: Joanna, Elana and Lucia. Elana was my personal favorite, with mozzarella, olives and sopressata salami.   Beverages are somewhat limited, but that doesn't mean you'll be disappointed. Bottles of wine are affordable. The Italian Pinot Noir was excellent at $25 for the bottle. They also have two types of beer on tap, Four Peaks Kilt Lifter and an Italian brand I cannot recall. Soft drinks include cane-sweetened colas and root beers.  Dessert options were also limited, likely because the pizza is so good most don't have room for dessert. The creme brule was topped with fresh fruit (strawberries and blueberries). The flavor was quite good, but I felt like it should have had a thicker layer of burnt sugar.  The size of the restaurant adds to its charm. By my approximation, it seats no more than two dozen diners at one time. Bill, the owner, was working with just two employees Saturday night. At times the action became frenetic, but they worked with a smile, and were never too busy to engage in conversation. Despite the fact that there were people waiting to be seated, we never felt rushed.  Get here before the AZ Republic reviews this place. Because the line will be out the door once the word is out!
This is the finest pizza in Scottsdale and maybe all of Arizona. You're crazy if you don't come here and have a dinner. Service is wonderful and you can sit out door on the patio.

We have been to Il Bosco a number of times. Hands down the best Gluten-free pizza in Scottsdale. Love that they use organic ingredients, Fresh toppings and great pizza combinations, not to mention the lovely outdoor, courtyard dining. Well paired wine list enhances the meal.

As an Italian with high expectations in this area of food, I went into this restaurant with high expectations. In doing so I look for two primary concepts in a restaurant, the food itself and the environment. Bosco Pizza implemented both the food and environment excellently.  Environment: Once I walked into the restaurant I immediately felt welcomed. I was hit with the aroma of the Italian pizza as well as a welcoming environment from the owner himself named Bill. While the restaurant was completely full, he managed to get the five of us a table within five minutes. Once we received our table, Bill was incredibly friendly and the restaurant itself gave off a social vibe to it. I was incredibly impressed by the look of the interior design. It was small, yet filled with more than one would expect from an Italian restaurant. There were multiple unique decorations and the specials of the day labeled clearly near the kitchen. When we ordered the food, Bill was incredibly informative as well as clear of the kind of food we may want to order. We had a friend who was dairy free and he was clear on what she may enjoy as well.  Food: I was thoroughly impressed by the menu. There were a myriad of options and unique menu items. I order a pizza called the Biaggia. This masterpiece of a pizza consisted of prosciutto, fig jam, goat cheese, and arugala. At first bite my taste buds were hit with a plethora of flavors without being overwhelmed. While it was on the expensive side for the amount served, I was given a great return in flavor. If I was to give a complaint, it would be that I wish it was a larger serving. With this said, one should know coming in that Italian pizza is thin crusted and generally served for one or two people.  TL;DR With this said, I would highly encourage anyone to try II Bosco Pizza. This restaurant has combined both environment and the food itself for a masterful combo in order to provide the most excellent dining experience. I rarely give five stars, but this restaurant greatly exceeded my expectations. I will be returning soon.  (The pizzas are named after the owner's acquaintances)
Superb service, food ! Eat local!!! Casual, indoor/outdoor seating,  Restaurant full of great decor,  character, very cozy, friendly, warm, what more can I say!!!

I cannot recommend this place enough. The food, staff and location are fantastic. Quaint but very happy and the salads and pizza are fantastic. Their prices are so reasonable you can afford to come often - and should .  We are visiting from out of town and found this place on Yelp. Great find!

I am a Chicago born and raised pizza lover . I have had many Brick Oven pizza's. Found most to be ok. I am in the valley for several weeks. I decided to give II Bosco Pizza a try. It's location was easy to find and it is a small and inviting. I walked in and was greeted by the owner and I took a seat at the counter which gives you a great view of the Kitchen.I ordered a Caprese Salad and the Biaggia Pizza.  The Menu is small but easy to navigate. My server was friendly and from Chicago as well. The salad came and it was like no other caprese salad I have had including Italy. Fresh Mozzarella along with Barrata Mozzarella which has a creamy center topped with airloom tomatoes dizzled Balsamic and a light touch of pesto. it was served with olives cured in house with several slices of in house made bread. I watched my Pizza being made and it was timed perfectly to arrive just as I finished my salad. The Biaggia Pizza might sound odd but it will be the most AMAZING experience you will have in your pizza eating experience. The dough has a slight wheat taste that compliments the fig jam which is lightly spread on the dough, then goat cheese is added baked to perfection. the pizza is cut and topped with prosciutto slices  on each piece and topped with arugula and evo dizzled on top and some custom house mixture of grated cheese.   You must try this  6 Star Pizza Restaurant. You will not be disappointed by the Food, Service, and Price. It is a valley hidden treasure.
We love everything about il bosco..the food is first rate, and delicious . Not too pricey. The owner is terrific..friendly and accommodating. Our go to pizza choice!

First time customer and will be back. Good Caesar salad and 2 delicious pizzas. Met the owner (very kind) and they placed the pizzas in the oven so they were hot after baking for 2 minutes. Tasteful and they have a family that will return.
Great addition to the cookie cutter North Scottsdale food scene.  No better pizza anywhere in the country.  My wife and I can't wait to go back.

I generally don't write reviews after 1 visit unless things were really great or really horrible. I had seen this place on yelp and it was pretty highly rated and I had a cousin visiting from out of town so I thought, pizza, why not, lets try Il Bosco!  We walked in the door and we were immediately greeted by "we have no room" from a white haired man named Bill (who I later deduced was the owner because he had his tweenage son working there as well). Hi to you too!   Alas he found us some space at the bar. I set my things down at the bar, and I happened to have a bottle of water with me that I didn't want to leave to roast in the car because it's Phoenix in July and that would be a waste. I had every intention of ordering a drink. He confiscated my bottle of water and placed it behind his counter, looked at me like I was some sort of village idiot and asked me if I brought my own food in for him to cook, too. I was dumbfounded. He only returned the water after my mom insisted she would put it away.   After reviewing the menu I ordered the Elana pizza without salami, as my cousins requested. Again, I got the you're-an-idiot face from Bill, and a "you just want a pizza with olives?" Why yes, sir, is that gonna be okay with you? I'm freakin paying aren't I? He did seem to be very friendly with customers that he knew or were regulars. Sorry you didn't give us that chance.   I was literally OVERWHELMED by the condescension. And then to add the icing on the cake he kept coming by to make sure everything was great and acted all reverent and friendly when we got done and were leaving. Its too freaking bad, Bill. Because Brent(?) and Gerardo and even your son Max were all lovely human beings and the pizza was pretty good too.   But if I wanna feel like an idiot I'll take a calculus class, not come to your pizza joint. Wont be returning.

I love finding little Phoenix gems. il Bosco did not disappoint. There were fresh herbs growing on the patio and wood being put in the fire. The menu was very small, but the prices were good for the size of the pizzas. You could tell that the pizza ingredients were fresh and top notch. The place is very small but feels cozy.

Best pizza in AZ!!!!! Having been from the east coast, I know pizza quite well. And during my 5 years living out there, this was hands down my spot! The owner is very friendly and his product is reminiscent of the pizza I got back in NY!!!

I am an Italian who has travelled the world and has been a high level chef for 40 years. This is "hands down, the best pizza"! I judge pizza on 3 things: crust, sauce and cheese. Il Bosco is the only place that I have awarded 5 stars to all 3.  Extremely quaint & charming. I love that it is kind of hidden. My only suggestion would be for more consistent, knowledgeable service staff.

This is some seriously good pizza!  We read the reviews on Yelp, and gave it a shot last night.  We called in our order, and the staff was very friendly on the phone, and explained that they would not put the pizzas in the oven until we got their, so that they would be fresh and hot for us to eat.  We got the Dona and the Biaggia.  I was worried that they would be tiny after some of the reviews, but they were both a decent size and bursting with flavor.  I was a little reluctant to try fig on a pizza, but the previous reviews told me I had to.  It's a winner!  If you have not gone here yet, give it a shot.  Very excellent pizza for not a lot of dough!

This delightfully charming pizzeria has impeccable food and superb service. I live in Los Angeles but make a point to come here each time I'm in town. There's a darling patio with heaters in the cool months; the indoor dining space is rather small, but it's part of the charm.   If you're not making reservations (only taken for parties of 6 or more) you might have a little wait, but not to fear - you can have an Italian beer or nice glass of wine at the bar, and you'll probably make friends with the regulars sitting to your left...and right. This place is popular, and for good reason. The quality is unparalleled, and yet the owner is as humble as can be. Tonight I watched a Postmates guy wait for the pizzas he was delivering. The staff made him at home with some ice water and a dish of their signature olives; how very charming, I thought.

I don't get it.  Highest rated restaurant in this area??  Do not be suckered.  Service was poor with zero personality.  No water was served or even offered.  Wine served in a cheap juice glass.  Only two beers on the menu, two.  Oily Caesar.  Pizza was okay.  People review this place like they've never had a wood fired pizza before.  Trust me, go to il Capo up the street for a better experience in every way.  Or even Gramaldi's.  Yelpers, you are often right on, but you let us down this time.

Simply the best pizza!  We have been frequenting this AMAZING find since relocating from Charleston, SC where we left behind our much beloved EVO.  Il Bosco never disappoints!  The service is warm, personable and top notch!  And the pizza !!!  We adore the caprese salad, any pizza on the menu and dessert here is a must... the warm brownie with ice cream is to die for!  Our southern hearts have found a new pizza haven in Il Bosco!
Went here for my birthday and had a great time. Only negative was they ran out of bread and our server had obviously not been serving long. The pizza is by far the best in the state!

Phoenix is a pretty good pizza town, and this place is definitely in the middle of the pack. Nothing really bad about it, but not much stands out either. Honestly, I think my favorite bites were the complimentary starter olives.   My friend and I split an order of fried ravioli and a margherita pizza which was plenty of food, and our whole tab was only $20. The ravioli was fine, but again, nothing remarkable. I liked the pizza, but I felt adding a little red pepper and parm helped the flavor. At better places, I don't have to do that.  I wasn't particularly happy with our server because he was very condescending when I told him we needed our check right away because we were late for a movie. He said, "You know, no one in history has ever been late for a movie because they were eating at a restaurant." Then he proceeded taking his sweet time getting our check and making change. Prior to that exchange, he was much more pleasant.

Needed to find a new lunch place in Scottsdale so I searched YELP..found this one and we tried it..   Very charming little spot. We ate outside and that was absolutely pleasant! Asked what to have and we were recommended to have the Biaggia. (Fig, prosciutto, arugula oh my..!) it was perfectly devine.   Prices were perfect for the individual sized wood fired pizza. Def going to go again! We have been looking for a good wood fired pizza with similarities to the el Vicino Pizzas(CO) styles. yaaaa :)
Absolutely delicious. I thought I was teleported to Italy! Excellent service and food. Will definitely be back!

Great dinner!! 15 years in the f&b business and this will be my most favorite spot going forward. Everything from the house brined olives to the amazing pizzas. Everything has the authentic touch were missing in Scottsdale. We will be back so often

Il Bosco has nearly 300 awesome reviews for a reason.   The pizza is tremendous in every way. Everything is homemade and you can tell from the vivid flavors.   Mr. Forrest and his family operate this gem and are nothing short of wonderful. Having a meal here is like going to a good friend's home for a relaxing, perfect meal. The ambiance is warm and cozy, the music is on point- the service is spot on, and again- the food is epic.     It's worth noting that they also do a great job with takeout. Simply place your phone order ahead of time- and when you arrive they will fire your pie- and two minutes later you're out the door.  One other thing I must highlight is the bread you get with dinner. If you are a bread aficionado- you will flip out when you try their house made bread. It's incredible and they would be a successful bakery if all they did was sell that bread.   The location is great and they also have a lovely patio for dining when the weather doesn't feel like the surface of the sun.   Give this wonderful spot a try. I have tried all the "best" in AZ and I unequivocally rate Il Bosco #1.  Try it and you will too.    *Bonus pro tip- if you have leftover pizza, for the love of God don't reheat it in your microwave. Either reheat in the oven or fire up your BBQ for a quick warm up. You'll thank me.
Unexpectedly great.  Ate outside and listened to live country music from the bar next door.  Fantastic food, friendly service.

Il Bosco is my favorite pizza place in the valley!  I have been to all the ones you know and all the ones that your friends tell you about with glowing eyes having just been to some great new hidden pizza place that they think they have just discovered. Let me know tell you, none of them compare.   It's a cosy place where you feel like family. The Canadian owner is super friendly as are all the servers. You are served some delicious olives which you can buy a jar of to take home. I prefer the Lucia pizza which normally has sausage and mushrooms but I get with pepperoni and mushrooms instead. The pizzas are all wood fired and when you take a bite you feel like you are in Naples instead of Scottsdale. My friend gets the Biaggia which is their prosciutto and argula pizza and if that is your thing this is where you want to come. It is so well balanced with the fig jam and earthy.   Go to Il Bosco! You will love it, scout's honor!

Great little spot. Service is killer. Great variety of unique pies. Or traditional if you want. You can tell they use the best and freshest ingredients. In all honesty, I can't believe there isn't a line out the door.
This is great small italian restaurant. It's very small but has a nice feel to it. The food is excellent.
Very good pizza in a small restaurant that also does catering.  The owner is a nice guy who really cares about service and the quality of his food.  We will definitely be returning.

My husband and I first learned about Il Bosco when they were catering a friend's party. I thought the mobile wood fired oven was a great idea. It was parked in the driveway, and the pizzas were served up fresh.   Since then, we've visited the restaurant numerous times. We usually go for lunch as the 8 inch size pizza is just right. All of the toppings are good. The crust is super. It's crispy on the outside and tender inside. The fresh made dough has a good taste, too. It is as close to the pizza in Italy as we've found.  The owner, Bill, is usually there. His hospitality is great, too. There is a nicely arranged patio up front. t's a small, friendly local place. Try it!
Yes! Yes! Yes! Pizza. Service and an authentically wonderful owner.   Why haven't you been here yet?

We love wood fired pizza restaurants and this one was quaint.  The owner and staff were great. We were asking the owner a ton of questions about the place, food, etc and he was very generous with his time. The pizzas were really good, sausage good, cheese was yummy. The bread, also made from the pizza dough was nice and crusty with a chewy center. The caprese salad was grape tomatoes with fresh mozzarella and a nice surprise, burrata. Very fresh and good.  He grows his own herbs too.  This is a must try!

I have been a patron of Il Bosco for a while. Being an X New Yorker I love pizza and noisy restaurants.  I have noticed that Il Bosco hardly ever has hardly any patrons in the restaurant.  The wine pours are very small and that bothers me ($8.50-$10.00) for a 4-ounce pour.  Some of the appetizers are quite tasty but recently the Cesar Salad (twice) has been tasteless. The pizzas are always tasty.  The restaurant looks old and tired, I believe this is a major turnoff to visitors and is a reason the place is never busy.  Basically, it lacks any atmosphere and character of an expensive restaurant.  Plus there is lots of noise from next door from a cowboy bar which is very annoying if you eat outside.  The bottom line, good pizza but when you drop $50-$70 for dinner expectations are not met. I hope the owner totally renovates or moves and builds an upscale place.  It will drastically improve the image and make him more profitable.

This wonderful hideaway has truly gourmet wood fired pizza, fresh salads and a very nice wine list.  The staff is attentive and personable. The owner takes an active and engaged role in the establishment. The bread and olive standard appetizer is a scrumptious treat!  The patio is beautiful at night (too sunny during the day) with a casual elegance perfect for an Arizona supper.

Great decor, bright and open.  Wood fire pizza oven is right in front of you.  Ingredients are high quality and the owner Bill is a really great guy.  The prosciutto, fig and goat cheese pizza was amazing.  Also, the housemade burrata was incredible.  They just installed a herb garden out on the patio.    I used to frequent this place when it was a previous business and owner.  It is completely flipped the mood of the environment and is a great new addition to the neighborhood.  We plan to frequent and often.    Don't ask if they are going to be open to the wee hours as in the past businesses.  It's not gonna happen.  Nice.
Best pizza in Scottsdale! Authentic and quick with good service.

Thoroughly enjoyed our Mushroom/Sausage and Basil pizzas accompanied with Moretti draft and Pino Grigio.   Capped off the great meal with the Chocolate Chip Cookie Ice Cream desert.   AWESOME.  Thanks Bill (owner).   We will be back often!

Been there twice for lunch. First time was pizza. Second time sandwitch.   The menu is inexpensive, however you dont get much. These are light faire. No stars taken off for that, just letting you all know that a pizza here is about a slice and a half by weight compared to a normal 18" pie. For me to get full I ordered a salad $6 and entre $6. You might be a smaller eater and get either or. The execption on pricing is the beverages. I ordered one ice tea and was unpleasantly surprised when I saw the bill for it was $5.75. EDIT: The ice tea was 2.75 and the tap water my coworker ordered was 3.00.

The owner was our waiter and he was very nice. He even started the deep fryer so we could have fried ravioli even though it was lunchtime and they usually only serve that at dinner. The ravioli and pizza were excellent and prices reasonable.
Awesome restaurant! The pizza is so delicious and the service was fabulous! Judith was such a fun waitress and Bill (the owner) was very attentive and extremely friendly. Would go back in a flash.

I'm a huge fan of rustic, delicious pizza and Il Bosco is "winning"!  In the same style as Pizzaria Bianco and Pizza-a-Metro, this place is small, intimate and does pizza the best way.   Totally worth the visit.

OMG! Pizza heaven. I just had my first pizza here and it has jumped to the top of my list. Similar style to Pomo or Bianco but something about this one....crust was just perfect. Toppings not overly done so you can taste each ingredient. Friendly staff and a nice , cozy setting. Will be back soon!  Joanna , I love you .....

I love this place. Starting with the ambiance, which is small, dark, cozy, and Italian, I was impressed. We came on a cool rainy night and sat at the bar, right in front of the wood-fired oven, and the owner made friendly conversation with us the whole time.  We split the Biaggia (prosciutto, goat cheese, fig spread, EVOO) and the Dona (mozzarella, pancetta, roma tomatoes, parmesan, and tomato sauce). The crust was perfectly chewy and had a slightly sweet flavor, which I love. The toppings were fresh and high-quality. I just wish we had more room, because we also really wanted to order the egg and pancetta pizza. Next time... and there will be a next time!!!
The place is cozy and the owner is typically the server which is great.  Loved the varieties of pizza, amazing flavor from someone who knows how to make a great pie.

Had the pleasure of dining at il Bosco last night for my birthday and just wanted to share how great of an experience it was. The restaurant is small and does not seat many people so we were sure to make a reservation (they only offer 2 slots each night). At the last minute, we had to add 2 more to our party which they took on with no issue at all and were able to accommodate all of us. The food is awesome, the ambiance is great, quick and friendly service. All around, this was a very authentic Italian experience at what I consider to be a fair price point. The pizzas are intended to be personal size but if you're not starving, they could definitely be shared. For dessert we tried to vanilla gelato, spumoni tortufo, and a brownie. All of them were delicious but the spumoni was definitely the winner. At the end of our meal, the owner offered us all a taste of his homemade amaretto which was fabulous. Absolutely recommend this place for anyone looking to enjoy a good, affordable, authentic Italian experience.
We got a Joanna pizza to go. Pizza was good. One pizza fed two adults. They are about the size of maybe a medium. Atmosphere inside was nice. I will be back.
Absolutely the best pizza!  Salads, meatballs, olives...you name it - everything is 5 stars here.

Awesome Pizza!  My favorite is the steak salad and bread, served with the olives.  Yum.  Perfect meal and I never feel heavy or overstuffed, just the right amount with great ambiance. A perfect cozy clean unassuming gem!  A mastery of sauce, bread, quality cheeses, and freshness.

What a wonderful experience. One of my regulars keyed me into this place and I was beyond impressed.  Friday night during prime dinner hours and we were lucky enough to get a table inside. They have lots of seating outside which would be perfect come warmer weather. For now they have heat lamps.  Service was impeccable. The owner floats around and helps his staff and enhances the dining experience (completely unlike the other review mentioned). We were brought a carafe of water, olives and bread to start. We ordered the caprese salad to start. I would eat this EVERY DAY. They use a pesto balsamic glaze that is to die for. The mozzarella is fresh and the cherry tomatoes were bursting with flavor. Next we had one of their specials, fried ravioli. Simple and tasty. Portions here are well sized without going overboard like the chain Italian restaurants do. To finish we ordered the Becca pizza, another special. The crust is delicious here and not one you would want to leave uneaten on the side of your plate.  I can't stress how fresh and wonderfully prepared everything was. I personally cannot wait to go back (did I mention how amazing the caprese salad was?!). This restaurant earns the five star rating because our experience was flawless and anyone who experienced otherwise must be mistaken.

Really enjoyed my meal at il Bosco pizzaria. The restaurant was small and had a quaint feel. Wood fired pizza is my favorite. I was with a group who ordered 3 pies which were all delicious. I didn't have the peppers stuffed with sausage but apparently they are "to die for".

We come here about once a week. Hands down my favorite place in the valley and the best pizza we've ever had. Bill is always there and gives the place a great feel-most of his family works there too-rarely have we found a place like this in the US.

Delicious! I had a personal cheese pizza for lunch today and I loved every bite of it. The atmosphere is super cool. I loved sitting outside. The staff was very nice. It's a little far for me so I probably won't make it back again but if I did I would try to come for dinner. I bet Il Bosco is even prettier at night. Highly recommend!

I just went back to Ct. for  the wedding of my business partner (one of the greatest events I have ever attended) and visited World Famous Pepe Pizza in New Haven, Ct. on a Sunday Night with my Mom and nephew to do a direct comparison of Bill (Scottsdale) vs. the Legend (Frank Pepe: New Haven, CT)  ...  Do a Yelp search ... Frank Pepe Pizza, New Haven, CT ... they are world famous.  Ronald Reagan and Frank Sinatra used to have pizza flown to them from New Haven, Ct. as it was so highly regarded.  When I lived in Ct, we would drive from Middletown to New Haven at least once a month.  The final results are in ... (Frank Pepe will not be happy)  Bill in Scottsdale is better (it even surprised me) ... Everyone who reads this should give Ill Bosco one try and understand that the absolute MOST delicious pizza in America is in of all places Scottsdale, Arizona and produced by someone who was once the premiere PGA Golf Coach in America (2006 PGA Golf Coach of the Year)  in a location that is virtually impossible to find.    How is this possible?  ... Most of the pizza in Arizona is sub-standard and everyone living here knows it  ...  You mention going out for pizza in Arizona and most everyone from back east figures they are going to suffer through a lousy meal.  But Bill has done something different.  In a state filled with mediocrity (or less), he has taken pizza to an art form.  You think Pizza Bianco with all their national publicity  is Number 1 in the state of Arizona ??? ... WRONG ... Yes Bianco has great pizza (i've eaten there and enjoyed it even though they have the most uncomfortable seating as everyone is packed together like sardines), but Ill Bosco is better (check the other YELP reviews to see if i am just blowing smoke).  And eating at Bill's is comfortable ... plenty of elbow room and a vibe that makes you appreciate Scottsdale ... you just want to sit and enjoy which is something very rare in 2014.  And to top it all off the owner is a Gem ... When you walk in, it's like being part of a family.  You won't be coming just once ... Give it a try ... You'll see.
What a great local pizza place!  Neat outside atmosphere and the kale salad and pizza was delish!

Best pizza in the valley without a doubt.  Absolutely excellent, better than Biancos, Pomo and some other very good places.  Had the kale and spinach caesar with pancetta.  It was incredible.  Also had "the Elana", pure heaven.  So flavorful.  My new favorite place.  Open on the weekends for lunch and dinner; during the week for dinner only.
The very best italian pizza in Phoenix, we take everyone that comes to town here. Yum! Try the biaggia

Friendly staff.  Great casual yet intimate atmosphere. Get there early! It's a small place and fills up fast.  Very accommodating to get you a table as soon as possible.  So great to find a Super T glass of wine.  Love the house made sparkling water.  Meatballs were flavorful and hearty.  Pizza had yummy fresh ingredients and sauce was perfect.  Next time I'm getting dessert!

Friendly staff. Cozy restaurant with a wonderful patio. Started with olives and bread (free) and then ordered the Caprese Salad, which was wonderful and our delicious wood fired sausage pizza! Definitely will return.
Place is amazing!!! Pizza was the best hands down. So close to real Italian couldn't believe!! Highly recommend to try!!!

We were just talking about the best pizza we've ever had and my wife and son realized they had both been here on separate occasions. Both emphatically agree it was the best pizza they have ever had ... and our family appreciates great pizza - very discerning

My husband and I stopped here for dinner this evening, after reading several rave reviews on yelp.  We were not disappointed!  We had the Carmela and Joanna pizzas, both of which were fantastic.  In my husband's words, the crust/ topping combination was "orgasmic." We'll definitely be back again!

Watch out Pizzeria Bianco, this place is just as good without all the hastle. My wife and I shared a salad (don't remember the name but it had lots of steak in it) and a Lucia pizza for lunch. Wood fired pizza was perfect and the salad was huge. Can't beat the bread which is actually made from the pizza dough. Service was excellent. It's a small place but they do have outdoor seating. Give it a try, you will be happy

The most fantastic pizza, appetizers, and lovely service.  Do not miss the homemade amaretto! Like liquid butter!  I could not be any happier! We go out every Sunday but this was by far the best Sunday meal we've had for a very very long time!
Wonderful wood fire crust and great 'guenuine' sausage slice from Guido's of Chicago (in Scottsdale)....that crust with the wood fire flavor...wow!!!
Really excellent thin crust pizza. Salads were good but not great. Very cozy and friendly ambiance.

Wow, this place is so cute and on top of that, it is delicious.  My hubby told me about this place almost a year ago and he was raving about the pizza.  Then, I have seen all the check- ins from Anna M., so I kept trying to make time to come and check it out myself.  I wish I had come sooner, although my hips and thighs might not appreciate that.  We ordered the Biaggia pizza.  I learned it is the most popular, I chose it mainly because I saw figs and prosciutto on it, two of my favorite ingredients.  Then we noticed the next table having a salad I didn't see on the menu.  Well, duh, it was in the specials.  They have daily specials on boards above the bar area.  We decided to share the spinach and kale caesar.  It was so fresh and tasty.  Then on the other table, I saw a dessert that was not on the menu either.  The owner told us it was an apple pizza, part of the special menu also.  Yes, I love to check out what everyone else is eating.  Our dessert was warm and amazing, and the scoop of vanilla  ice cream completed this perfect meal.  We were offered a taste of their homemade Amaretto.  What a treat, it was delicious.  This place made me very reminiscent of my daddy, we used to cook all our italian dishes on Sundays and my daddy used to make his own Lemoncello.  I definitely will come back and I won't wait almost a year to make it.

Amazing staff and authentic fire wood pizza. Fantastic outdoor patio. Catering is available. It has a cool vibe and relaxing atmosphere. It's next to Handle Bar J and is somewhat hidden. There's a good wine selection and awesome appetizers.

I wandered in here last week, late on a Friday evening, and found the place almost deserted.  Bill greeted me at the door, I asked if I could have a meal, and he sat me down at the bar.  Almost immediately I was impressed by the hospitality.  I looked at the menu, which is just a sheet of paper with drinks on one side, and pizzas, salads, desserts, and antipasti on the other, and found it promising.  Why?  Not because it was extensive, but rather because it was limited.  I like a place that just does a couple of things, and does those things well.  Each day there is a different pizza of the day, salad of the day, and I think antipasti of the day.  My first visit, I went with a split pizza--half Maria (pesto, garlic, and tomato) and half Biaggia (prosciutto, goat cheese, fig, maybe something else)--along with a Boylan's root beer.  The root beer turned out to actually be a Boylan's Creamy Red Birch Beer (Bill said he promises his customers this is the best root beer they'll ever have.  It's partially true, in that it's better than many root beers, but it's technically not a root beer. Get it anyways.), which was actually a nice surprise. (Boylan's Birch Beer would be even better...)  I liked the Maria, but I LOVED the Biaggia.  This was a very good pie, and based on the other reviews here, it possibly could be considered their signature pie.  On my second visit, a week later, I had the Dona, a red pizza with tomatoes and pancetta.  The pancetta was nice and crispy, and of course, delicious.  They also serve you olives while you wait; these were some of the best olives I've had.  I couldn't stop eating them.  They actually tasted fresh (well...as fresh as an olive can get, considering you have to basically wipe out their original bitter flavor when you cure them).  The best part about this restaurant is that it has the feel of a small neighborhood restaurant.  It gets busy during the dinner rush, but if you come a little later, it'll be more relaxed, and you can actually strike up a conversation with the staff.  Good pie, excellent establishment.

Best wood fired pizza in the Valley - my wife loves the Biaggia - I like to check the specials (last year, when they were in season, they had a Hatch Chile pizza that was the best pizza ever!).  Bianco?  Pomo?  pfffttt!  - Il Bosco!!!  Great pizza, cool vibe - check it out!

We happened to stumble upon Il Bosco by chance. The service was wonderful and the food delicious. The owner made sure we were taken care of and enjoying our meal as well as our server. Very helpful with recommendations. We had the Adrianna, Biaggia, Joanna and the special of the night. All were wonderful but the Biaggia seemed to be the table favorite! I've found my new pizza place.

I love living in Arizona. Everything you need is within 10 minutes of each other. We were looking for a good pizza place and this little gem just might be it. It's cute and quaint and offers excellent wood fired pizza! It was cooked perfectly and had that delicious wood fired taste to it. Delicious home made pizza sauce as well.   The owner was incredibly kind and welcoming as well. He spent a lot of time talking to us and making lovely suggestions for us to explore our new city.  He really knows how to run a business and make his patrons feel comfortable.   I can't wait to come back.
Loved the pizza and atmosphere is intimate and fun! Have the Valentina spicy with a bit of sweet it's awesome!!!

We genuinely enjoyed our evening at Il Bosco, a tucked-away restaurant just off Shea and Scottsdale. The owner and staff were super friendly, the ambiance was what a good neighborhood restaurant should be (though so many aren't) and, of course, the food was great! We began with an appetizer plate of roasted brussel sprouts with mozzarella, an unexpected combination that really works! We then had the Joanna pizza, a fantastic, wood-oven, thin-crust sausage and pepperoni that had great flavor and crust. For dessert, the days special was a lemon sorbetto, packed into a real lemon, a perfect ending. I should also mention the great music selection which added quite a bit to the flavor of the evening. I'm already looking forward to the next visit!
If you're looking for gourmet wood fired oven pizza, this is the place to go!  The prosciutto, fig, goat cheese, arugula pizza is absolutely delicious!

Great food!! Fresh bread with perfect chewy crust! Their wood fire pizza was cooked to perfection with the crispy soft crust and perfectly charred bottom. We chose the Baggia pizza which had prosciutto, fig jam, four cheeses and arugula. Wow!! What a great combination! I love this style of pizza!! For dessert we had spumoni encased in dark chocolate. OMG!! So rich and delicious! Will certainly be back!!

We had a great meal and experience at this local family run business. If your staying in the Scottsdale area this should be on your list. Awesome homemade ingredients, friendly staff and an owner who takes great pride in his pizza. Well done!
I got the Joanna from here and the pizza taste as good as it looks, I give it a 10 and the customer service was outstanding and the workers were very friendly, I'll definitely be back for more

This place is a bit cozy, but once you've settled in it's not very noticeable.  The set up is very shabby chic, but its clean and appealing.  The owner runs the service very well.  He was on top of all his customers' needs the whole way through, directing the kitchen and the supporting waitress and chipping in himself to make sure everything was well.  The complimentary bread looked disastrous - it was cold and looked like it was undercooked.  One bite though and it was the best Italian bread we'd ever had.  The flavor was so good.  The caesar salad was also excellent.  We had the mushroom and sausage pizza, which unfortunately was burnt.  It was a bit bitter, or else we probably would've eaten the whole pizza.  The red pepper flakes were super flavorful which I appreciated a lot - most places' flakes are stale and doesn't provide this much kick.    So usually the burnt pizza at a pizza place would definitely lose a star or two, but I can't help but love this place.
