The owner was so nice, and even gave us some homemade amaretto that was off the charts.  It was great on our dessert of chocolate covered ball of chocolate, pistachio and strawberry gelatos.  The hospitality of the place, the quality of the food and service, and the set up of the place are why I'm a super fan of this restaurant.  I'm hoping the pizza will be good next time too!

We were welcomed by Bill the moment we walked into this cute pizzeria. The caprese  salad was outstanding as were the meatballs. I had the prosciutto, fig, and goat cheese pizza. Amazing. Give this place a try. You will be happy you did.

Oh how I love pizza and this place was just great!  The space is cozy and really comfortable, the staff is amazing - we had the opportunity to talk to the super friendly and knowledgeable owner - and the pizza ranks up there as some of the best in Phoenix.  If you like hand crafted pizza, definitely check this place out!

I appreciate when I have been to a place and  they # 1 remember my name, #2 thank me for my business and #3 give me the same excellent product every single time I come in. As I told them, my daughter may rip into the box the second I picked her up, 30 minutes away and she did! I called her and said I had a surprise! She got in the car, saw a science experiment kit...long face.then her nose ever so slightly caught a quaffed of what? what? " Is that Il Bosco?!!!" in the highest pitch thrill. "Pull  over! Pull Over!!" I said, " Roll down your window" in my best Corleone voice,"Pizza Delivery is yours"..so as we sat along Osborn and devoured pizza, her inside, me out. A sense of complete sublime bliss was the picture I foretold. As I said before, I am not a pizza girl, but there is something about the encumbrance of Il Bosco pizza that I needed tonight. They had no idea that I would be sitting and watching and weeping to a cancer benefit on TV, because of family and friends and Taylor and Ronan. Yet I picked their pizza to comfort me. The Biaggati)?) Salty and Sweet and different  and wonderfully complex yet  simple in crust. l  know this was without doubt the exact comfort I needed and will yearn for  because of all of  the above mentioned reasons.  It heats up perfectly at home, and although you may not have the same charm as being at Il Bosco in person, you have the same love ensconsed in their box of pizza pie.

It was ok. Ex New Yorker, like the pizza.  Small wine pours, limited menu,waiter a bit unpleasant...when finished seemed like they wanted us out of there quickly. Not impressed. Music next door not great. Probably won't go back.
This is so good. All good pizza and every thing on the menu is meant to be there. Great hipster soda and great service. Go here!
Delicious food, excellent beverages, and employees that become your friends during dining experience!

I had worked around the corner from this cute place for years, and for some reason everyone at my work raved about it... and I never went! Fast forward to a couple weeks ago, when I was craving a good pizza, but didn't want to make that infamous drive/wait in downtown Phx.   Me and my best gal showed up, and were promptly seated for dinner on a Thursday with little to no crowd around 6 PM (that quickly changed). We started with water and some delicious olives, and moved onto to the pizza... Let me tell you, if I could have one pizza for three meals a day, it would be the Valentina. Sweet/spicy-all in one. You NEED this in your life.   I woke up the next morning so sad we didn't order two pizzas and have leftovers honestly. So if I could change one thing, it would be that! Also, the owner is ridiculously sweet and stopped by the table. I will be back, and telling everyone about this place!!

Fantastic pizza! Hand stretched dough, house made ingredients, wood fired deliciousness! Staff is attentive and genuine! The space is cozy and its just the kind of restaurant I like to eat in. A true local business!
Just had our first pizzas from Bosco. Great pies, great flavor. Nice people too. Only dissapointment was the Ceaser salad. Overpriced for a simple small dinner salad.
Just the best. Fantastic owners/chefs/staff.  Delicious, fresh & such an intimate little setting.  I'd recommend their pizza to anyone - it's SO good!!!

We've been searching for a quality pizza place for a while, and this weekend, we found it in Il Bosco! The owner, Bill, waited our table himself and was so friendly, attentive and conversational. You can tell that he and the staff take a lot of pride in the quality of their food!   We elected to sit inside, which seemed to be the right choice, since the music next door was pretty loud and could have easily overwhelmed the outdoor seating area. The place was small, but quite cozy with a great view of the food preparation and pizza oven. Seriously, I watched that oven, and nothing sat in the window for more than a minute before it hit a table (impressive!!)   We started with some of the most tender, delicious meatballs I've had, sopping up the delicious marinara with our fresh, hot bread. Sooo good! We went for the Carmela pizza and both loved it!!! The ingredients were of very high, fresh quality, and it was piping hot! The wine was okay ($9 a glass is a little high for table wine in my opinion), but they kept our glasses full and we loved it! I hope to save some room for spumoni next time... Give this place a try! (They also offer take out if you're more interested in pick-up pizza!)
food was good place was quaint and fills up fast so go early or extra late. we all tried different pizzas which are fire baked, was it the best pizza ever no... but definitely worth another visit

Excellent service, quaint, adorable ambience, and wonderful food!!   I was greeted by an incredibly kind manager who took me to my table and also checked back twice throughout our meal. Our server (I wish I could remember her name!) gave excellent, thoughtful service and went above and beyond to accommodate our requests.   The entire staff works like a team - anyone who brought us plates or drinks was equally as friendly and attentive. This is a great little gem in North Scottsdale definitely worth checking out.   I especially recommend it for date night on the patio - very romantic and intimate setting. I look forward to coming back!

Excellent! My husband and I are visiting from NM and had heard great things about Il Bosco. We were not disappointed! Jered our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and answered all my questions about the menu. My husband got the Lucia pizza with tomato sauce, mushrooms, cheese, and sausage. The mushrooms were small and quartered, which really added to their flavor. I got the Adrianna pizza with tomato sauce, cheese, and chiffonade basil. Both pizza's were delicious and the crust is to die for! We'd never had such wonderful crust on a brick oven pizza. It was crispy and chewy, absolutely perfect! I had the lemon sorbeto for dessert and it was wonderful! We will definitely be back to this wonderful pizza joint.

In the area and felt like pizza.  This place had a good rating so we tried it.  Had the kale and spinach salad.  It was good, not a big fan of kale.  Also had the fried ravioli which was ok.  It was on special so wet tried it.   My wife and I both had a pizza.  We should have shared one as they were bigger than we thought.    We actually had a whole pie to take home.   The service was great, they keep on top of where we were with our meal and timed the pizza to arrive when we finished the ravioli and salad.   I definitely recommend this place.

Great pizza cooked in a coal fire oven.  Light crust, great ingredients and they wait till you get there to fire the pizzas.  Perfection!  What I would love to see is a Margherita with bufalo mozzarella on the menu!

Excellent food, great service.  Authentic Neapolitan style pizza.  You can hear the live music from The Handlebar next door - if you're OK with Country/Western while eating Italian food, that is.  Not the very best old world style pizza "I've" ever had, but it's pretty good - and very good for Scottsdale, which can get a bit tourist-centric.  Very good.

First time to Il Bosco and I was not disappointed. We shared a Calabrese salad and the pizza special. It was a perfect amount of food for two and delicious. The timing of delivering the pizza to our table was great as was the consistency - no soggy middle like you get other places. The proprietor was friendly and helped us make good choices. The spot is cozy and their brick oven catering looks phenomenal.

If you have not been here it is a must try! The food is incredible and the owner is great. The restaurant itself is small and the outside is nothing fancy but once you try the food you will understand what is so special about this place!

We love this place. I have been working on and off in Scottsdale for the past 5 years. I always try to find a night on each trip to take a pizza or two out for dinner. Friendly people, great wood fired pizza and always done to perfection!

Found this place on yelp and was amazed by all the five star reviews. Finally went in last week with the wife and sat at the bar.   Food was great. We had the two pizzas. One was the fig and arugula and one was red sauce with pancetta. Both were great. I'm picky about pizza crust and this place nails it.  The owner seemed super nice added to a great experience. Looking forward to going back to try other pizzas!

Small yet perfect. I always worry if there will be room for me but some how there always is. I love this food! I love this restaurant! I get the Mia pizza, its heavy but it is so good. They have a wonderful small staff. Food to go and food there, both are amazing!

Awesome pizza! We will definitely be back when we come back to Arizona. Being from North Dakota we don't have a ton of good restaurants so this place will be on our list for future visits! The owner was super nice and the patio seating was great. The crust on the pizza was perfectly toasted to perfection and it had some amazing sausage and Italian bacon!
Really good pizza try the Carmela and lucia. Don't forget to order the cesar salad best ever. Not the classic pizza something really good made wood fire
Your standard Neapolitan pizza set up that gets a couple of bonus points for its mobility and flair for getting creative with their pies.

I loved everything about Il Bosco from the food to the atmosphere but did not appreciate it when the man serving us rolled his eyes at me when I asked to sample a wine. Now had this been a server who hated his job, I could've shrugged it off but this man was the OWNER. Then after I enjoyed it enough to order a glass, he forgot to bring it to me (we were one of two tables on a Tuesday night). This is why I'm giving three stars instead of four, possibly five. You can't skip out excellent service just because you have excellent food (which Il Bosco truly does) and the owner of the establishment should know this and provide this and if he can't, he should hire someone who can.

Great food, check.  Convenient location, check.  Friendly local owner, check.  I had been referred to Il Bosco by a fellow yelper some weeks back... And finally decided to venture out for a casual lunch. So happy that I did.   The pizza here is wonderful-fresh ingredients in yummy combinations, straight from a woodfire oven. I tried two different pies, the Caprese salad and their creme brule.  All were well made and the service speedy and friendly.    The store front can be hard to spot (blink and you might miss it), but I actually like the "hole in the wall" feeling of a smaller local business. Take the time to seek this gem out!

The owner is sooo nice and friendly! He makes you feel welcomed! While the restaurant is small, the food is INCREDIBLE! When I close my eyes and take a bite of the pizza, I feel like I am in Italy! Even charging for the bread reminds me of Italy and for this place, I am OK with that,

Mouthwatering cuisine really can come in a small package and Il Bosco is here to prove that size definitely does not matter! I met the lovely Anna M for lunch recently and much to my delight, she introduced me to Il Bosco.   Hidden down an alley on the north west corner of Shea and Scottsdale Road, Il Bosco is a humble abode filled with a whole lot of flavor. The restaurant itself is tiny and probably only hold around 50-60 people. Upon walking in, I was immediately greeted by the scent of pizza baking in the wood fired oven and a feeling of hominess with dark wood and brick paneling and close seating. You know those restaurants where they offer you an "eating in the kitchen" experience and make you make a reservation months in advance for the chance to "dine with the chef" Well here, you get to do so every time you visit because the open kitchen is just steps away from the seating. Therefore you get to see the pizza being created from scratch and here's the best part of the entire experience...the pizza cooks in 90 seconds! Yes 90 seconds!   I ordered the Biaggia which comes with prosciutto, figs, four cheeses, arugala and evo. The lunch pizzas are personal pizzas so Anna ordered the Lucia which comes with cheese, tomato sauce, sausage and mushrooms. I could smell the pizza being made and I started to drool with anticipation. Finally a whole 90 seconds later, poof! The pizza appeared and I took my first heavenly bite which turned into many more heavenly bites. This pizza is some of the best pizza I've ever had and I have had my fair share of pizza! The crust is a combination of crunchy and chewy and it's seasoned to perfection. The toppings are a perfect combination of sweet and savory and compliment the crust perfectly. I must say that the Biaggia was by far the most superb pizza I've had in quite some time. The Lucia was also extremely good but the Biaggia stole poor Lucia's thunder. It was a delicious lunch and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It's one of the best kept secrets around but I don't think it should be a secret. Everyone should experience this pizza!   I will leave you with one more little fun fact. They have a portable wood fired oven that they use for catering! It's amazing and would be great for a party. I also noticed that they have a walk-up window where you can order take-out.

We have gone here twice so far and both times we were very happy with our pizza. We usually call in and pick it up with no issues. The owner seems really nice and the restaurant is beautiful. We have yet to sit down and eat there but I am sure it would also be a great experience. We take our pizza seriously so it's always refreshing when we have awesome pizza choices nearby.

SIRI found Il Bosco for us last summer when we asked for pizza on our way home from Kierland.  There are many good pizza spots near our home, but we are always hoping for something more artisanal.  This small, almost hidden wood-fired  pizzaria was the find of the year for us.  We have brought family and friends many times and have never been disappointed. When our company needed to find a caterer for a two hour event for 100 guests at the Phoenix Children's Museum I did not immediately think of Il Bosco.  The event was to be akin to a happy hour with wine/beer/soda/appetizers.  I really didn't want anything to do with the planning or execution of the event - I am not good at such things and I don't enjoy the process.  It wasn't until after seeing quite a few other options that I raised my voice.  The Phoenix Children's Museum is a wonderfully playful and unique setting and I felt we needed a more comfort oriented option. I remembered the pizza oven on wheels that sits in front of Il Bosco and asked my assistant to call the restaurant to see if Il Bosco offered event catering. We promptly received a catering menu with set prices based on number of guests.  We liked what we saw immediately.  A few days later, I met the planning team at the restaurant for lunch where we were offered samples of 5 or 6 pizzas that could be made on-site at our event.  It was a hit.  We selected a salad option, drinks and desserts. We received a VERY reasonable quote via email immediately.  Bill Forrest, the owner, went personally to the museum to meet with our team and museum staff to coordinate the set up and execution.  Bill offered suggestions without being intrusive and in every way demonstrated a willingness to "make it work." The event came off without a hitch.  The food flowed at a perfect pace - it takes just a minute or two to cook a pizza in that 800 degree oven.  Pizzas were consistently hot and in keeping with demand.  The salad and desserts were top notch.  Everything was perfect.  The sight of a wood-fired pizza oven at the event raised a few eyebrows and added to the anticipation of the evening. The absolute crowning contribution of Il Bosco to the evening was their having the forethought to bring pizza boxes and offering our guests fresh pizzas to take home.  It was a very nice and unusual courtesy as many of our guests had children at home. Il Bosco made us look good.  Our choice of a wood-fired pizza caterer made our event stand out.  Their professional appearance and behavior were exactly what we would have expected.  Il Bosco shines not only as a restaurant, but as a caterer.  Most highly recommended.

After a long day of moving and stress we hit this lovely local pizza spot with fabulous staff in Barbara and Bill.  Their Kale Spinach Ceasar salad is one of our favorites. The wood fires pizzas are amazing. Bill's homemade Amaretto is divine. Good service, fab food, reasonable pricing, casual ambience, perfection!
Came here before going to the movies and we will definitely be back. The food and the service was top notch! Very happy we stumbled upon this gem.

Okay, I'm from NY.  This place is mere blocks from my house, and I've never been there before.  That will shortly be rectified.  Simply put, the best pizza I've had in Scottsdale.  Or in Phoenix.  Or in Arizona.  Hell, the best I've had west of the Poconos (I'd say west of the Hudson River, but there are some REALLY good pizza joints in Jersey).  Can't wait to try their Pananis.  I just keep saying to myself WHY haven't I known of this place before.   All that lost time.  Sigh.

Just went here and really loved it.  The owner is pleasant without being obnoxious.  The pizzas lie somewhere in between a high quality American style pizza and a Napoletana pizza.  We had a caprese salad with high quality tomatoes and medium quality mozzarella.  The basil, olive oil dressing was wonderful.  The pizzas are tasty with excellent ingredients.    The atmosphere is simply wonderful and cozy.  It's a small space but interesting and nicely decorated.  For amazingness I still rank Pomo #1 for pizza, Andreoli #2 (they only serve pizza a couple of nights a week) and Bosco is in the next category.  This is a great place so make sure and give it a try.
Second week in a row I ate here. As close to perfection as you can get. From the Caesar salad to the pizza to the creme brûlée and espresso it was wonderful.  I am a new regular. Thank you

Wonderful wood fired pizza. The Cremini mushrooms are wonderful on the sausage pizza. This little hole in the wall pizza joint is worth searching for, just east of Handlebar J's.  They even have a portable wood fire pizza oven for catering.

So so cute! I had no idea this place was tucked away here. There are so many good restaurants in this area, but this one I would've never even known about if it weren't for yelp. I came here tonight with my sister, and we both thought it was nice, the inside is a bit small and no one was sitting inside when we came! Outside we could hear the live music from next door which was fun haha. I loved the little lights. One complaint is it was too crammed..it was basically like sitting at the same table as the people next to us which was a little bit weird. Also we had to pick up and move the table to get in and out of our seats haha. But it didn't look like all of the tables were like that!  The bathroom was nice and clean which is a bonus. The lady who seated and served us was nice, everything done in a timely matter and she made sure to check up on us! My sister wasn't sure if she wanted the meatballs or a salad. She got the salad and wasn't a huge fan. It's a small portion for $7 and didn't even have caesar dressing, it had some other type of dressing. The croutons were weird too, I didn't like them. The bread with oil was tasty! And luckily, the pizza made up for the mediocre salad. Very good quality stuff! A tiny bit too soggy in the middle, but otherwise totally excellent. I'd love to come back and try out the pesto pizza! Would recommend this place too!
Great pizza. Device was friendly and polite. Very patient with my kids had 1 million questions. We will definitely be back

(Lyrics - Kelis - Bossy)  Il Bosco It's a fresh bite to scream up my Yelp It switched up the beat to my heart That's right it brought imported cheese to the boulevard And that's right, it's the one who's firewood oven to start   Il Bosco It's a place y'all love to date It's a place that's raised the stakes I told Yelp Phoenix there's no debate I'm back with an appetite cause it's Bosco   Il Bosco Pizza is a locally own spot quaint and popping with some firewood cooked pizza; this place definitely has a lovely charm to it.    I came on a rainy evening so the place inside was packing!  I would say the inside seats a max of 35 people including the bar.  The open kitchen where you can see the firewood oven was an allure while chef craft his work.    We started with a bottle of wine plus some Fried Ravioli.  The ravioli came along with some sweet marinara sauce and had a decent soft doughiness to it.  Next we shot for the Caprese Salad; which was my favorite.  It came with Burrata cheese along with the traditional Mozzarella cheese, tomato, and balsamic.  Overall, one of my favorite bites of the night.  Fluffy burrata along with smooth and stringy mozzarella cheese ending with a sweet balsamic punch.    For our pizza we ordered their Biaggia & Carmela.  The Biaggia came with prociutto, fig jam, four cheese, and arugula.  Overall, a decent bite but I felt the arugula was over-powering.  The fig jam was light and I wish they would put more on it.  The Carmela came with tomato sauce, sausage, spinach, and caramelized onions.  The tomato sauce was a welcoming pairing with the saltiness of the sausage and sweet onions.  In the end, Il Bosco Pizza is a little sweet spot for some farm to table pizza.  Traditional Italian bites with some allure of the ambiance.  The firewood oven is awesome to watch, but not sure how well it fares during the summer months. - Enjoy!

Such a fun little hole in the wall! We're from out of town and found this place on yelp. We were expecting something hoity-toity but it wasn't pretentious at all. The pizza was amazing and a surprisingly affordable lunch option. So fresh and you get your pizza in less than 10 minutes after ordering. Great little unique place and the owner was very friendly and made us feel right at home!
My family and I have made this a regular in our local dining rotation and it is by far our favorite pizza in the valley. QUALITY ingredients, and the staff is always warm and friendly.
Consistently exceptional fare, great service, neighborhood ambiance. Don't miss this place. Pizza, salads, appetizers, desserts...all top notch.

Il Bosco is a hidden gem with authentic "real" Italian pizza like the pizza you get while in Italy. Everything is made from fresh organic ingredients and "il capo cuoco" just doesn't cut corners. Everything is delivered with pride and care - fresh olives, thick-crust fresh bread and olive oil to start and the water and ice tea are served extra chilled. Love this place and we often find our regular table to enjoy the best pizza in Scottsdale.
Just plain awesome pizza and staff.  Kinda hard to find but you should definitely seek them out.  This will be our new Scottsdale pizza stop!

Food was great, prices were incredibly reasonable for the quality of the food,  the best caprese salad appetizer you will ever have , pizza was cooked to perfection with layers of flavors and textures, get the goat cheese and Fig house specialty, you won't regret it ! Dont forgot to enjoy the home made amaretto to finish off a special meal. Enjoy Italy for one night in Scottsdale. Cheers.

The food and service are beyond exceptional! They had a nice selection of wine. I had a red that was delicious. The creme brule' with fruit was maybe the best I've had. I'm looking forward to going back soon.

With a 4 1/2 star average on 155 reviews, there's little I can add that hasn't already been said.  It just feels good to add another 5 star vote for a pizza that is unusually good.  Standing out as much as this pizza stands out should mean something.  From every big city to every rural town, there is always a pizza place.  Our own USDA published a scholarly paper earlier this year calling pizza the world's most popular food.  On top of that, I've lived my entire life in Chicago, and notwithstanding the ridiculous notion some New Yorkers have that they know good pizza, most knowledgeable foodies agree that Chicago is the pizza capital of the universe.  And we do have terrific pizza in Chicago.  Lou Malnati's, Fox's, Toni's, Pequod's, Vito and Nick's, and on and on.  But there's something about Bill's pizza here that seems to always be served with a kind of pride and love and devotion to the product that is plain and simply rare.  The mozzarella is exquisitely fresh, and every single ingredient, from veggies to meat, is fresh and flavorful.  The tomato sauce rivals the best in Italy itself.  The crust is so good that it stands alone as a homemade bread of the finest ingredients.  And yes, I've had the famous Pizzeria Bianco, and Grimaldi's, and Oregano's, and they are all perfectly acceptable pies.  But Il Bosco is simply in a class by itself.  It's all done in a very small space, no reservations accepted, a little hard to see from the street - no matter, do whatever you have to do if you want one of the absolute best pizzas in a world full of pizzas.  I'm lucky, because when I visit Scottsdale several times a year to see my son and his family, he lives very nearby, and we can go at odd hours and avoid the crowds.  But whatever it takes, do it.  You'll see what I mean.

Love this place! It's dark, intimate and they do pizza really really well. The limited menu tells you how serious they are about getting the pizza right. The brick oven makes the crust so crispy and their toppings are always very fresh. If you're looking for a casual place to have great pizza...look no further!

This place is a hidden gem. Tucked back in an awkward shopping center, I would have never expected this greatness. Il Bosco offers one of the three best pizzas I have ever tried. The atmosphere and ambience of the restaurant was great and I hope I am in the area again so I can get another taste of greatness.
This place was great! Pizza was absolutely delicious and the atmosphere was amazing. The setting was perfect for an intimate evening with my partner and his mother

Went here for dinner after finding it on Yelp (or course). The food was good. We got the pizza with the figs and arugula (sp?) on it and it was delicious. The owner was friendly but maybe a little too friendly. It's hard to eat when someone is trying to talk to you the whole time. We had 1 slice of the pizza left and asked for a box. He took it to box it up. Finally when we paid and were wanting to leave we asked for our box and it turns out the food got thrown out instead of boxed up. No big deal since it was just 1 slice but if it had been more we definitely would have asked for another pizza to replace it.

My wife and I revisited this place after hearing from multiple people it was of the two best pizza places in the greater Phoenix area. To start, the vibe is great. Very small, tucked away Italian shop where you quickly get the feel that you have known the owner/waiters for months already. Needless to say, the service is great. The owner came by on both our visits and chatted with us about whatever it was we wanted to talk about - this time, restaurant reviews :) Now we ordered a Cesar Salad to share, 3 pizzas between 4 of us (we had guests) and a cookie dessert. The salad was delicious. Very light dressing with farm to table greens. It isn't your typical Cesar though, much more airy. The portion size is on the smaller end. The pizzas are incredible. We tried the classic margarita, Lucia and fig spread one (can't remember the name but definitely their signature pie). It has a classic Italian touch to it but not as thin; more of a hybrid between the thin Italian and doughy New York.

One of the best pizza places in the valley. Very small inside but the food is fantastic and the service is awesome.   Nice touches of comp olives and bread.   Expensive wine by the glass but decent selection.   Definitely worth the drive from Chandler.

Wonderful! If you are a fan of thin crust pizza without overpowering sauce - THIS IS IT! Noyt a lot of variety, but I have tried four different ones and they are all excellent, brick oven done. You won't be dissapointed and the place is very cute/casual! Has become my "go to Pizza" for both "eat in" and "take home"
A hidden gem in Scottsdale. The pizza compares favorably with the best in Arizona (Pizzeria Bianco), the patio is lovely and the service is great. Run, don't walk to Il Bosco!

The food is incredible! The staff is friendly and helpful. Joe and I tried a date night there, the problem for us was that toddlers love pizza! Inside the restaurant is small so once the kid started throwing silverware we moved outside. The Caprese salad was awesome though!

Yup. It's all true. Great food, super charming place, very intimate.   We sat outside on the patio under a heat lamp. Enjoyed the olives as a starter, as well as some fried raviolis (yes, please) and a caprese salad app.  Outstanding artisan pizza, with as good a crust as I've ever had, and homemade mozzarella. Wine was just ok, but very reasonable. Server was attentive, helpful and friendly. Owner came by a couple times to check in on us and was absolutely delightful.   Deduct a point for the proximity to the Handlebar J Saloon and the faux-cowboys arriving in limos with 10-gallon hats. Then add a point back for the near-fight we got to watch between a biker and the faux-cowboy who almost hit him with his Cadillac.  We'll be back, and with more friends.

This is my favorite pizza place in the valley. The fig, prosciutto, goat cheese & arugula pizza is out of this world! The owner operator is super friendly. Last time he sent us home with a loaf of fresh baked bread!

I don't write Yelp reviews, but this place deserves it. Il Bosco is amazing. If you want authentic pizza, from a real non-chain family business, this place is it. Great place for a date, or to have dinner with family or friends. The service here is personal, authentic, and just enough. Your server will likely also be the proprietor. The pizza is stellar. Order meatballs for an appetizer. Order whatever is on special for the evening. This place is small and intimate, in good ways. Sit outside when it's nice out. Support small business, authentic pizza, and visit Il Bosco aka The Forest.
One of my favorite restaurants. Always get their Mia wood fired pizza. The owner Bill is one of the nicest a guys you'll ever meet. This is a MUST visit if you are in town.

The pizza was so authentic, it brought us right back to our summer in Rome. The ingredients are fresh and wonderfully prepared. We got the Valentina and the Biaggia; both were very special, with great complexity of flavor. However, I'm not sure what all is included in the dining experience. For example, we got complimentary olives, but larger groups got bread and olive oil too. Large groups also had a water decanter on their tables for refills. We were sort of neglected after we got our pizzas and were left sitting without any water for most of our meal. Furthermore, some tables had flowers, others didn't. Since the restaurant is really only open during the evening, I would suggest a candle on each table, instead. This would be more cost effective, and would give the space an even more romantic vibe. Lastly, my amoretto was complimentary at the end of my meal. It was incredible (like butter), but the restaurant shouldn't just be giving that away for free....it's too good. Bottom line, everything needs to be consistent. Every table, every group (no matter the size) should have the same service and experience. That being said, I loved the food here, and would gladly return.

Listen guys. I got a pizza from this place. The fungi. It was picked up by my wife and got to me about an hour later. Still one of the best pizzas i've ever had. It was unbelievable and they definitely don't skimp on the toppings. I have no problem going out of my way to eat here. It's totally worth it. If every pizza I get here from now on is 80% as good as the one I had I will be eating here forever.
Bill and his crew treat everyone like family. The food is excellent and at-home hospitality cannot be beaten. We've been here a dozen (or more) times and have never been disappointed.

Excellent pizza, service and reasonably priced. We will be back again to this hidden gem. We found it quite by accident and I am glad we did. Just the smell of the wood fired oven was worth the trip. Watch out for the serrano peppers growing outside, they have a bite!

I'd like to say it was good but we haven't had a chance to eat there recently. The last three times we've gone in the owners tell us they're closed, this time closing in 10 min and then give us a blank stare. That was at 8:10 on a Saturday night! Look the pizza is good, the appetizers not so much, we've been going there for years but this is a new thing, closing at 8:20? Looks like they're doing so well they don't need our business anymore. Pomo pizza a few minutes away sure was happy to have us.

The pizza may be good; however, we didn't get that far!  Atmosphere might be like eating in a morgue - owner is rude and a terrible host!  We walked out and will NEVER return.  On to POMO - OUR FAVORITE!

I found this place a couple of months ago and it is hands down the best pizza in Arizona. I come from the East Coast where pizza was invented, and Il Bosco Pizza rivals the best pizza restaurants there including Pepe's. Service is always great and the pricing is very fair. Bill the owner is super friendly and cares about what he does. There is magic in the pie because of the blend of cheese, sauce and dough. If you are looking for the best pizza in Arizona, you better try this place so you can compare the rest to the best!

Not sure why it took soooo long to discover this GEM!  Great little place for wine and pizza.  Service was excellent and the owner was very attentive to all his patrons.  Felt very warm and inviting.  The meatball app was cooked to perfection.  All the pizzas were spot on and delicious.  Will be back again!

5 stars across the board. Excellent service, very cool owner who came over to talk to us, great dessert, and awesome homemade amaretto to finish the night off. Will definitely be going back  soon with friends.

Best wood burning gourmet pizza ever!!!  We loved it and our kids loved it!  Fresh ingredient and the crust is cooked to perfection, not too thin and too deep.  We spoke to the chef and he is super nice and friendly and it was really quick!  Love the little restaurant but it is small and it gets packed during dinner time.  Lunch was great and their lunch prices can't be beat!

Great, intimate wood fired pizza place. Delicious crust and simple well balance ingredients. The focus is a top notch, simple delicious pie. Wine is served in water glasses, just like growing up in an Italian household. Owner Bill is almost always there with a friendly welcome. The staff is attentive, friendly and casual. Small 5 seat bar that puts you basically in the kitchen... love it. 5 stars! Come here you will not be disappointed. Oh nice big patio also.

Wow..  Amazing wood fired pizza.  The owner was very friendly and nice.  Hand thrown pie.  So delicious daily specials on pizzas.  Caprasi salad with fresh mozzarella.  Stone ground bread with very tasty Italian olives on the table. We felt like we were in Italy.  Well worth a try.

The BEST olives, root beer, roasted vegetables, bread and pizza I have ever had!!! Better than Pizza Bianca by far!!! Addicted!  Jan. 21, 2015 - and I'm still addicted but I'm as thin as ever!! My wildest dreams come true!! A pizza that doesn't make you fat!!!

We ordered takeout pizza from Il Bosco after reading the Yelp reviews. My pizza had a burnt bottom...like it was dusted in flour and then burned. It ruined the whole thing. The sausage was just fair. My husband's pizza was soggy and "wet" as he called it and he said it was one of the worst pizzas he has eaten. We so wanted to like this place--the patio and interior were charming. Still, food is what makes the rating for us and this hardly deserved even the 2 stars.

A friend told me about this place, saying it has the worlds best pizza! She had taken her food to go, but I went and ate on the enchanting patio. It is a very charming place that made me want to stay there all night eating and talking. I had one of their specialty pizzas. It was absolutely delicious! Our server was very nice. There was another male server, Zach, who stopped to help and chat with us. He was such a doll, and went above and beyond any service expected from a waiter. I will absolutely go back. What's even more exciting is that in a couple weeks they are will be offering brunch as well! With the chefs taste palate for the unique combination of tastes- I can't wait to try more!

Great neighborhood restaurant! Went for the first time for a late dinner and was very impressed. Adorable, chic, intimate restaurant that feels very authentic Italian. The menu is simple and straight forward, again a nod to true Italian Pizza and Salad.   A friend and I split the Kale and Spinach caesar (excellent flavor)  and the fig, prosciutto, arugula, and goat cheese pizza. Literally the pizza had all my favorite flavors in one, and with the perfect crust it was excellent. Great over all restaurant and will be back again soon!

I went to Il Bosco with my mom and sister last night and it was fantastic! The small atmosphere is so fun, and the pizza was some of the best I've had in a long time. The owner and staff were all incredibly nice and very accommodating. This place is a gem in Scottsdale!
This place is the bomb. Wood fired pizza...we had spicy sausage and peppers (the day's special). Get a red root beer too, a new staple for us.

Great service, great pizza, amazing dessert!   Found Il Bosco on Yelp and I'm so glad that we did! As soon as we got here we were greeted by the owner. Although there was a short wait (5-10 minutes) he found us a spot to sit and got our drinks right away. We ordered the Dona which was delicious. The crust, cheese and sauce were amazing! We finished with splitting the brownie a la mode and considered ordering another because it was that good!   Would absolutely recommend this to anyone in the area! We will definitely be back!
It was our first time here for dinner. We had very delicious wood oven pizza and appetizers. Servers were pleasant :) this is very low-key and lovely cozy place!

This is our neighborhood restaurant, with a great location and great atmosphere.  We especially love the outside patio area.  They grow their fresh herbs right outside on the patio.  We've been coming here since day one, and it just gets better and better! Tonight we had the caprese salad which was amazing as was the handmade wood fired pizza. We topped the night off with the Creme Brulee with fresh strawberries.  Everything was so delicious!! This place is perfect for any occasion. Dinner for two or something larger. In the past, we've held my daughters sweet 16 party as well as my 50th bday surprise party.  This is a place you can always count on.  Thank you Bill!!!

My guy and I have been to Il Bosco twice now and it is quickly becoming one of our favorite pizza places.  Both times we got the meatball appetizer, a salad and a pizza.   The meatballs are delish - not spicy but very flavorful and the sauce is great for dipping the bread that they give you.  We've had the traditional Caesar and the kale spinach salad. Between the two we definitely preferred the kale spinach. The Caesar has a thinner dressing on it that isn't bad, it's just not the creamy Caesar I was hoping for. I believe the same dressing is on the kale spinach salad and it fits better with the thicker kale. Plus the kale spinach has pancetta on it - can't go wrong there.  The pizza is definitely the standout here. The crust is done perfectly - not charred and not soggy in the middle. The sauce has a nice flavor and the toppings are placed in just the right amount.  The owner has been there both times and is very warm and welcoming. On our second visit his son was our waiter and was very pleasant as well. The service is fast and the atmosphere friendly.   We will definitely be returning. How else would we become Il Bosco regulars?

This is the best pizza in Phoenix, no contest.  I've eaten at pizzeria Bianco many times and I will be moving my business to Il Bosco. You can read my review on Grimaldi's and how i stated it was missing something,  well Il Bosco has the "it" factor.  My wife and I dined here tonight and it was just a great, refreshing experience.  The place is on the smaller side, we sat outside which was great.  The menu is very limited but everything on it looked fantastic.  We opted for the Biaggia which consisted of prosciutto, arugula, a fig sauce, a squeeze of citrus, parmesan shavings and goat cheese. The other pizza we split was the special Zita. This was a white pizza with meatballs and carmelized onions.  Both pizzas were phenomenal.  The flour they use is organic so the pizzas are super light and do not sit heavy at all.  The service is also fantastic as both our waiter and the owner checked on us multiple times and were very informative.  Also, the pizzas came out extremely fast, like less than 5 minutes fast. I can't rave about this place enough, it's worth going out of your way for. .

I absolutely love pizza. I would have it for every meal if my family would let me. This place has amazing pizza and the service to match. It is very small so you might have to wait for a table or have to eat at the bar but the food is definitely worth it.

Charming place, the owner and Forrest is an great, very nice and so helpful made my husband , me and our 2 daughters feels so welcome and comfortable. He explained very well the menu, the special and told us they could make whatever we wanted that wasn't on the menu . It wasn't the place we chose to stop at first but were happy we did  . Will definitely come back again , not for the free bread and olive oil basket he gave us but for his welcoming and the charming atmosphere

My daughter found this in Yelp when we were in town on vacation from the East Coast.  Four of us went and ate indoors.  Small casual place with a wonderful owner.   We ordered the salsa, the stuffed peppers, the toasted ravioli, caprese, and one Eggplant pizza for all of us to share.  This was more than enough for the four of us, especially since we were originally not that hungry but wanted to try the various antipasto dishes.  The stuffed peppers aren't the large green peppers, but small red peppers with a nice bite to them and delicious sausage inside.   The bread was delicious.  My mother doesn't usually like cheese (except on pizza) but she liked the toasted ravioli so much that she wants to learn how to make them.  The caprese had fresh mozzarella and sliced cherry tomatoes.  The pizza was superb.  A nice change not to have breaded fried eggplant on a pizza but fresh cubed eggplant.  Everyone there was so nice and the food was delicious and came out quickly.   We were able to enjoy the food without feeling rushed.  I would definitely go back if we are in the area again and recommend it.

I love wood fire & brick oven pizza. So, found this tiny (and mean TINY) restaurant  by accident after ditching Jack N the Box. Its tucked behind fast food, big name franchises on the North/East corner of Scottsdale & Shea and is a nice little gem.   Besides how small the place is, the first thing you notice is the menu is very small (dinner menu is a little bigger), so me and my friend picked different things and shared. We got a personal pizza and a meatball sandwich. The sandwich was good, but not spectacular, but the pizza is awesome! I went back again for dinner and again the pizza was terrific, as was the salad; delicious. We asked them to do a half and half and they said no problem which is great; I hate when places won't compromise for make you feel guilty for changing their stuff. I loved it and my girlfriend loved it. Also something fun is their soda is not fountain drinks, but bottled real-sugar cane sodas that are delicious.  The only strange thing I have to say is the owner doubles as the server and he is very chatty. That's not a bad thing; he is a very nice guy but be prepared to have a conversation with the guy.  Recommend for a casual lunch and dinner for gourmet pizza & salad.  Pros: Amazing pizza, great food, great service and inviting setting. Cons: Very small menu; caters more toward veggie eaters rather than meaty pizzas.

WE LOVE il Bosco.   cute little sit down restaurant. I would imagine little cafe's in europe to be like their place.  The pizza's here are amazing. My wife ordered the one (forget the name) but they said it was their best seller. Obviously know why because it was AMAZING. mine was good, but her pizza made mine taste like crap.   If you like olives they serve a small tray of it before your food. I am not  a big fan of olives so this wasn't a big deal to me. But my wife loved it!

Amazing food and not just the pizza! We got the meatballs which were delish and the olive oil that we dipped our bread into was very sweet. The pizzas are perfectly per portioned and the crust perfectly cooked.   The owner was the one that served us and told us that the names of the pizzas have a story behind them which was fun to hear some of them.   It's an eclectic restaurant with church pews for some seating and unmatched chairs and tables which I loved. We sat outside because the weather is great this time of year.   What we ordered: Meatballs- juicy and tender and hot! The "Adrianna" pizza  because my fiance's nieces name is that and the "Gia" which was amazing.  PROS: everything CONS: nothing  We have found our go to spot now :)

Il Bosco has the best pizza in town! My go to place for my pizza fix. Bill is wonderful and always makes me feel welcome, and part of the family. Do not hesitate to make this your go to pizza place as well. You won't be disappointed. I have never had a bad meal here.

Il Bosco offers some extremely respectable pizza that is good enough to where my girlfriend and I come back once every few months. And with so many great pizza places in Phoenix, this definitely says something.  We've tried a handful of different pies, but thus far, the Mia (eggs, pancetta, chives) and Biaggia (prosciutto, figs, goat cheese, arugula) are two of our favorites. Ingredients and crust are high quality.  Even their bread with olive oil impresses, having that lovely rustic flavor that can easily stand on its own. The complimentary olives are a nice touch - if you like olives, of course. I rarely drink wine, but choosing a soda line that's exclusively from Boylan is enough to keep a soda junkie very happy.  The location is tucked away in a Scottsdale plaza. We almost missed it on our first visit, but I really like both the indoor and outdoor atmosphere. Tiny wood-fired pizzerias always work best in smaller spaces, because the lovely aroma immediately greets you when you walk in. Additionally, I've always liked places where the owner is actually there, working, serving, and interacting with customers. He seems to be very passionate about his pizza and clearly knows the craft quite well.    As for desserts, you have several options. We've tried both the regular brownie and pumpkin brownie, which were pretty standard fare. They have a chocolate chip cookie, which was incredible the first time we ordered it. Served warm and soft with a scoop of ice cream on top and consumed via spoons, it was a surprise hit! Think of a "pizookie," just baked a little further. The second time, we expected the same thing, only to get a charred cookie that was completely burned black, much to our disappointment. We have also tried the lemon sorbetto, which is served inside an actual lemon. Excellent stuff and probably what I'd consider to be your best option.  While I won't jump on the "So much better than Bianco" bandwagon, I still consider this to be one of the better options in the surrounding area.  Easily one of our favorites!

Great quality food with great personable service and a nice ambiance. What more do you want? The employees really were so friendly, we felt very welcomed. My husband got a sausage mushroom pizza and I got a cheese and basil one. One pizza could feed 2 people if you weren't extremely hungry. The pizzas were very fresh and seemed made from scratch. We also got a brownie ala mode for dessert. A bit pricey for the small portion ($7) but it was delicious.
I loved this place: They have burrata cheese! Loved the pizza and the people...cozy place to hang out on a regular basis to have a great glass of wine or beer on tap.

WOW!!! I see why this is the highest rated restaurant in 85260!!  I am super picky about pizza. I had Bianco, Grimaldis, pomo and on. None compare to this. MOST of those places that make brick oven pizza are too thin, the sauce bleeds thru in minutes and does not reheat well. This place has the best pizza of this kind I have had.  Not thin in the middle, amazing quality cheese!  Also got the meatball appetizer. 3 meatballs with marinana sauce, easily the best meatballs I have ever had. Not over seasoned or weird tasting.

came here a few weeks ago and the pizza is STUPID GOOD!!! :-)  its been a few weeks so i forgot the name of the pizza but it wasnt on the menu, it was written on the board, a daily or weekly special? it has peppadew peppers and i hope they have it as a special a lot or add it to the everyday menu. cant wait to go back  oh yeah, almost forgot about the olive oil. amazing !

Owner operated adding to a friendly environment and service.  A genuine establishment starting with quality ingredients and prepared with care right in front of you.  Delicious pizza!  I had and will definitely recommend the Biaggia pizza with prosciutto, fresh arugula, and a light sweetness from fig jam.  The Elana is very tasty as well with a nice savory and salty combo.  I look forward to returning and exploring more of the menu and specials.

We loved Il Bosco, we sat out on their patio with a heater and it was perfect.  The owner was so helpful in accommodating a group of 7 on a Saturday night, and provided great recommendations.  We had appetizers, salads, and pizza, and all were wonderful.  Don't miss the sausage stuffed peppadews or the caprese salad, the Caesar was great too.  We ordered 5 different pizzas thinking we would have plenty to take home, but it was so good we went home with 3 spare pieces lol.  Two thumbs up, wonderful find.

our friends recommended this pizza place and we have tried their pizza when it was catered to their house. This is our new pizza place. Authentic pizza not loaded with a lot of toppings and not too doughy. They come in one size only, 12 inch. They brought out small tray of 10 olives to nibble on. We started with Cesar Salad,$7.5; glass of Chianti $9 and Boylan Root Beer, $3.5. Followed by the Adrianna pizza and Lucia Pizza, 11.5 and 13.5 respectively. The Lucia pizza had sausage and mushrooms which was proportional and the crust was yummy. You could actually taste the mushrooms because they were quartered instead of sliced. My wife enjoyed her pizza and mentioned that if we want pizza, this is where she wants it. We finished our meal with a Lemon Sorbetto which was an actually lemon hollowed out and the sorbet was packed into it. Refreshing!! When you come, parking can be a problem and you might have to park north, a block away.
Pretty authentic Napoli style pizza place. Tastes great, and they have good salads and wines as well.

I came here on a double date with the Tasia, her brother and his wife. That in itself made the night a blast because to be very blunt and straight forward, her brother and I are hilarious and we make every occasion fun. So, if you need to liven up a party, give me a call, we will jump in his truck and rock your world    Now for the pizza. We came for the pizza, and we loved it. The pizza was delicious. We got 3 different pies ( 2 biaggias). We loved the pie biaggia, that was every ones favorite. We also had the Joanna and Lucia. I loved them all - they were delicious.    Why 3 stars:  1) We waited like 15 minutes for everyone to get a water. They ran out of glasses...This was ridiculous, and we got refiled about once in the hour and a half we were there  2) we were sitting outside, and the heat lamp was broken...tough to enjoy the meal when your shivering - This was in February, so hopefully some of the kinks have been worked out.  3) the meatball appetizer was subpar. Small portions, 3 tiny meatballs, and they were nothing to write home about  4) I like that they have boylan soda brands, but seriously, I would rather have refills on ice tea and a soda on tap then spend 2.75 for like a sip of coke   I will def come back here for the pizza. It is awesome, but I will bring a bottle of water with me

I don't get it. Maybe we just happened to go on a bad day, but there were 5 of us, and the food experience was severely lacking for each of us.   We all ordered different pizzas - each one was very, very salty. Uncomfortably over salted (and I like salty foods).   Spumoni was just taken out of the freezer and served to us. Tasted just like ice cream you'll get from the grocery store - in fact grocery store ice cream is better.   We all had a serving of mediocre food, followed by more of the same in the desert department. Oh, and it was all topped of with a healthy dose of service reeking of attitude.  Maybe our experience was an anomaly, but it was bad enough to dissuade us from any future visits.

I discovered II Bosco while searching on Yelp. WOW...what a great find!  The pizza was incredible, great service and really nice outdoor setting to enjoy the evening.   Finished off the meal with dessert, a delicious chocolate chip cookie a-la-mode and it was really wonderful! I'll be back asap to enjoy more pizza and probably another chocolate chip cookie a-la-mode.  Also worth noting the menu prices were very reasonable for the quality of pizza!

Words don't even begin to describe the love I have for this place!  The food is outstanding, as is the service.  I crave their pizza (and olives!) weekly and just wish I had the time to eat there more frequently!  Bill (the owner) is extremely kind and it's clear that he really wants his customers to be satisfied.  This is hands down the best pizza in town...yes, better than Pizzeria Bianco.  They've also catered a few events at my house and for my kid's school and done a great job!  Bryn DeFusco

We've been in search of great pizza with no "attitude" since coming to Scottsdale seven years ago and Il Bosco has been added to our great list.  We ate at Il Bosco last night and had a lovely evening.  The outside patio area is very cozy and quaint.  Service was outstanding (Pomo could really take lessons from the Il Bosco servers).  We ordered a Caesar salad to share which the server (who I think may have been the owner) happily offered to split.  Our pizza choice was the Dona which was delicious with melty cheese, perfectly seasoned red sauce, salty pancetta and sliced Roma tomatoes.  Before dinner teasers of delicious olives and fresh sourdough bread with a fruity yummy olive oil to dip in were an excellent appetite opener.  The after dinner homemade amaretto was a perfect ender. During our visit we noticed several take out customers leaving with not just one or two boxes of pizza but three, four and five boxes.  We knew we had arrived at the right place to satisfy our pizza cravings.  Thanks Il Bosco for a great experience.
Family operated and excellent service, Il Bosco serves up some excellent pies! Imports a ton of items from Italy. We love this place!

Love this place! Amazing wood fired pizza at an affordable price. We've eaten in the restaurant 4-times and have always had great service. We also order out and they wait for you to get there to fire up the pizzas. It's a must try!!

This is a tiny place that does an excellent job with Pizza.  The owner is friendly and involved with greeting and making sure that you are enjoying your meal and your time in the restaurant.  My wife split the roasted vegetables and a Caesar salad.  The vegetables were terrific, the salad was the only miss of the night.  We were expecting more and will skip it next time.  There will definitely be a next time as the pizza was terrific, great crust and flavorful.  Near Scottsdale Rd and Shea, find your way to this place.

Great hidden treasure.  Go there now, it wont be long before the entire valley finds out about this place.    I LOVE the essence of this place.  This is exactly what we need as a developing restaurant city.  Charming, high quality products and OWNER occupied (Refreshing).  From the moment you walk through the door, you know this place is different.  Rustic Charm.....  This owner backs it up with great personal service and a high quality pie.  NOTE TO OWNER - RAISE YOUR PRICES!!!  Yes, $12 was the most expensive on menu....  I thought it would 7 inches....  Great value but I felt guilty.    Try this spot out.  I hear they are opening for lunch in October!!!

The best gourmet pizza in the valley.  Forget all the other wannabes. Creative apps, salads and pizzas. Ambiance is fantastic. My wife and I come her all the time and are true foodies.  You won't want to go anywhere else after eating pizza here.

Small and quaint...until we got there that is. This restaurant is tiny.  There are about five tables inside. Somehow that was enough for us because they weren't busy at 8pm on a Friday. There are only a few choices of pizzas that they offer. The choices are good ones though. There is amazing free bread while you wait that is warm and soft. The pizzas are big and more than enough for the average person. The desserts were very delicious as well. I know this is a small complaint but the sodas are disgusting. They don't have Pepsi or Coke products just these custom cane sugar drinks. No bueno. The owner talked with us half of the time we were there. He is a cool guy. Just don't ever ask him for ranch, ham or pineapple for your pizza. It offends him rightfully so because his pizzas are pretty good. The service was okay but the server rarely came around. We didn't get our check until 30 minutes after we were done.
AMAZING. Best pizza place west of the Mississippi hands down. Perfect dough, and sauce. Quality that other places lack.
Amazing food! Great atmosphere! Mr. Forest himself went to of his way to explain all of the food/specials to us!   The short rib pizza was probably our favorite, but nothing a disappointed!
Amazing. Great service - unbelievable sauce. Had the caesar with meatballs to start. Half pepperoni pizza with the kids. So good!

If you want some of the best tasting pizzas with a creative flair at an awesome price without then attitude---Go here!!!!!   Food was great, we were surprised when the chef came over and gave us a taste platter of olive oils breads and even there own home made olives. My wife and I had a great time. We are going there again.
Some of he best pizza I've ever had. The atmosphere is amazing and makes you feel as though in you're in Italy. The owner came to our table and gave us personal recommendations. This is a hidden gem!

On a recent visit to Phoenix we were headed down Scottsdale Road looking for a place to eat. We decided on Il Bosco. Fellow Yelpers never let me down and they were giving this place 5 stars so I decided we needed to try it ourselves.   We were greeted by Bill, (golf professional) and now owner of Il Bosco. Inside the restaurant is tiny but charming. The menu includes starters, salads and pizza but before ordering check out the "special board" that hangs from the ceiling. We finally decided on the Biagga. It came topped with prosciutto, fig jam and goat cheese. It was incredibly tasty and the perfect combination of ingredients.   What makes this place special is the personal touch of the staff and the quality of the food. They are there to make sure you have a good experience. After only one visit I'm hooked! Some of the best brick oven pizza I've had and I can't wait to go back!

If this place becomes too big of a deal and I have to start waiting a long time I'm going to...well, I'm going to not be happy.  Tiny ceramic olive dishes! Calligraphy'd menus! A pizza oven that's RIGHT THERE! Dim lighting, a cute little (emphasis on "little") patio, perfect service and THE PIZZA. GAH.  Never mind. I was going to elaborate on the pesto-ridiculousness I've experienced both times we came here, but I don't want to share. Forget you read this. Carry on.

This was such a great find. In town for the weekend & having drinks next door. Decided to try the pizza and I have to say it's probably the best I've ever had !! The service was great, the good was excellent and the owner was very friendly & welcoming. Don't know if I'll ever be back in Scottsdale but if I am I will definitely be back!! This little place is a Must!!

The food is really good.  Pizzas are baked in wood ovens.  There is a smokey taste profile that differentiates the flavors from other places.  We got there early in the evening so seating was not a problem.  The staff was very pleasant.  They knew the menu and offered suggestions that were helpful.  We would definitely go back.

Definitely a fan - made the pick from Yelpers' reviews - and you all didn't steer us wrong.  First time hear - and not sure when the next time would be, so tried a few things:  the meatballs, the Biaggia pie and another special pie - red sauce, pancetta, red onions (I think) - all was delicious!    Like some other reviewers have mentioned, we had the opportunity to meet and chat with the owner - a very nice guy, who's really mastered the pizza art.  We ate outside - enjoying the nice cool evening air.  All in all a great experience!  Highly recommended.

Every visit is as great as the last!  We love to introduce locals as well as out-of-towners to this best in class pizza place.  What a special gem.  Another Phoenix downtown pizza place has garnered much nation wide coverage, but night for night we would pick Il Bosco over Bianca's!  And importantly, you don't have to wait 2 to 4 hours!  You won't find a better pizza in all of Arizona!  Not to forget, the Caesar salad is a winner too!

4th time at IL Bosco's and it gets better every time.  Sunday night light crowd and open until 8pm.  The fresh dough and custom high heat oven makes a perfect combination for a browned crust.  I must say my favorite pizza pepperoni, sausage and olive.  Appetizer was a Caprese  cheese and tomatoes which just is out of this world. We also had some cooked red peppers to die for.  Service was quick yet a nice dining experience with friends.  Two thumbs up! #bestPizza

I was so disappointed. After drooling over these pictures and rave reviews for weeks  I finally drove the ten miles to get my fantasy pizza. Imagine my surprise when they handed me this tiny box weighing almost nothing. I actually asked the waitress if she gave me the right order. Funny, she asked me where i'd heard about the place and I told her the internet, she said "Yawp (sic) ?..yeah most of those are family or friends, we got 5 stars or somethin'." That explains ALOT! Gee, good thing me and my husband weren't really hungry, twenty bucks for a snack? Not bad quality but tiny quantity for price. Sauce is kinda raw, undertaste of wine and exactly two nickel sized slivers of  garlic sausage per slice. Cheese is good quality. I see why the place was empty at 7pm on a Saturday. If your single or on a date and don't mind high prices go for it.
Great hole in the wall type place with excellent service. Great 12" pizzas and salads. Loved the sausage, carmelized onions pizza.

Wow. I made the special trip to Scottsdale to try out this pizza place. It is a small quaint little place. There was no available seating inside so we had to eat outside. If I were to come again, I would wait until Winter, because eating outside when it is over 100 degrees is really not enjoyable at all. I can see where eating outside during the nice time of year would be really fun though. I ordered the pizza with goat cheese, fig, arugula, citrus and Parmesan. It was so amazing. I loved the way my taste buds danced as I learned the different flavors in each bite. The pizza was a little pricey for what you get $15. But I loved it. I would definitely come back.

Aaaaah!! I love this place!  Fantastic food in a casual environment, and the staff treats customers so well.  It's tiny, so everyone is up in everyone's business which creates this happy family atmosphere.  Can't wait to go back!

This place was amazing! It is better than all the pizza places I have been to across the valley. My friend told me it is the best pizza he had since Italy, so I decided to try it. Definitely extremely impressed and will probably be back this week.
Really good, fresh pizza. Very small inside but seems family owned and the staff is super nice and really take care of you. Fried ravioli is also great.

Il Bosco aka "The Forest".  Excellent wood fired pizza and wine!  Good lay-back atmosphere.  This place is a little hole in the wall located in a strip mall.  You might drive right by it and miss it.  They have seating outside so when the weather cools down that would be a plus.  My only complaint is they weren't that busy and our waitress hovered and tried to take away plates when we were still eating.  All in all, I'd give it another try because the pizza was so good.  PS - they need to work on their Caesar Salad.  Dry and tasteless.  If they made homemade dressing it could be a star.
First time at this little hidden gem. Pizza was tasty and came out fast. Bread and balsamic is a great starter. The service was exceptional, our server was very knowledgeable and attentive!

We were starving and wandering around Scottsdale Quarter, so we decided to pop into True Food to eat. In spite of there being lots of open tables, they said there would be an epic wait - or we could sit with some strangers or on a sofa outside. I didn't feel like doing either of those things, so we split and headed south. I used yelp to find the best place that was still open and on the way.   Il Bosco showed up with the best overall score, and neither of us had eaten here so we decided to give it a shot. It's tucked away in a little nook next to Handlebar J's and looked cute and inviting. We wandered in and were seated right away. It's a cozy little place - clearly decorated with care and love.  We both ordered water (sparkling and still) and they came in these fancy artisan bottles that were left at our table along with a pair of small glasses filled with ice. I like when restaurants do this. They also brought out a tiny strange plate with olives on it. Neither of us eat olives, so we sorta poked at them, puzzled over them and dared each other to eat one.   The menu was elegant and beautiful - simple and hand written. We later got an explanation from the owner that he had a local artist make them by hand. Details details... this place is rich in details. The items on the menu were pretty much just salads and pizzas.   Everything about this place says "fancy fine-dining" and if I hadn't looked at the prices I would've thought it was going to be too rich for my blood. As it turns out, the prices were VERY reasonable. The only thing I thought was a little pricey was the water - on any other night I would've ordered wine though, and the wine prices were appropriate.   We ordered a pizza (half and half - something you can do as long as the sauces match) and a caesar salad. They brought some artisan bread with herb oil for us to snack on, and we made that disappear. The salad was split into two plates and we quickly ate that up as well - it wasn't drowning in dressing. It was an excellent presentation and a good salad.   The pizza then arrived... it was about a 10-12" woodfired pizza. My half was pepperoni and sausage. Her half was just cheese. Each half had a name on the menu - girls names if I remember correctly. We each took a piece over to our plates and started digging in. Right off the bat, I noticed how rich and creamy the cheese was. The pepperoni was light and had a perfect amount of spice behind it. The sauce was flavorful. The most notable part was the crust though - light, crisp, airy, and delicate.   We both cleaned our plates - the only things we left behind were the olives. We also ordered a dessert - creme brule - it was one of the best I've ever had. We were both full, but we didn't feel like we needed to be wheeled out to the car in a cart. It was the perfect amount of food. It was also pretty inexpensive for what you get. This is high quality fine dining with great atmosphere and attentive staff. This is a new date-night spot for me. It's also inexpensive enough to make it a regular spot.  Had a chat with the owner who was waiting on us most of the night, and he seems like a great guy. We could tell that he loved his business. I like supporting local businesses, and this 5 star review is one of the most deserved that I've ever given.
Caprese Salad, Lucia and Adrianna were absolutely delicious!!! We will definitely be back!

Been waiting to try this place for a while to feed my pizza addiction. I take it this spot depends on word of mouth because you would never know it was there unless you went to Handlebar-J's or paid attention while you hit Jack in the Box at 1am. Anyway wood fired pizza that is excellent, lots of nice combinations, we had the special called "Juania" that had spicy sausage, caramelized onions, and Jalapeño. Nice little wine list that had some Italian classics, very affordable bottles no more than $40. Overall a great spot to kickback and have a few bottles and pies. I have to say lastly that the quality of everything was great, extremely fresh and creative combinations on the pizza and apps for example the Caprese salad came with Burratta cheese as well which is something I haven't come across.

I've had Bosco's bookmarked for a few years and never had a chance to try this place. Decided to give this place a go today and boy have I really missed out on a really good place. Shame shame on me.   It's a small place that is somewhat hidden but we had no problem finding it. They have a decent amount of outdoor seating but indoor is quite small. About seven or eight tables. Very homie with a long wooden bench on one side with throw pillows all over the bench making it very homie. Most of the tables are two people tables but they do push the tables together for bigger parties. They also have an open kitchen. I think it's has a really nice ambiance. Somewhat loud cause everyone's enjoying their food.   Well, we were started off with some tasty olives and sour dough bread which I thought was really good. Olives weren't to sour and very tasty. We ordered the Roasted Seasonal Vegetables with Burrata. Today's veggies were Brussel Sprouts. My favorite. Very fresh and really tasty. Really loved it. The Burrata was lite and really went well with the Brussel sprouts. Really good dish.   Next, we got the Lucia pizza which had sausage and mushrooms. My wife was a little worried it was going to be salty but it wasn't. Sausage was fresh and really good. Mushrooms were really fresh. All the ingredients were really fresh. It was a good sized pizza and the crust. I enjoyed the crust. It was not too thin and not to thick. A little chewy but everything came together. It was a really good pizza. Probably the best I've had on this side of town.   For dessert, they have so many choices and the owner recommended the Lemon Sorbetto. It had lemon sorbet in a real lemon frozen. I was really surprised. Very light. Not to bitter. Very refreshing. Really good.   So we came to Bosco's on a Friday night but pretty early. We beat the crowd. Our server greeted us quickly and brought us water and our own bottle. There were at least three or four different people serving us and making sure everything was okay. Excellent service. Friendly service which followed the homie feeling inside.   I would say I really enjoyed our whole meal at Bosco's. Great food. Fresh food. Really good service with a wonderful ambience. The prices were even reasonable. All I can say is I can't wait to come back. They have speciality pizzas on the board and can't wait to try them plus their desserts. Need I say more.  Enjoy.

Great pizza! Nice atmosphere. I like the Lucia - cheese, tomato sauce, sausage, and mushrooms. My wife likes the Biaggia - prosciutto, figs, four cheeses, and arugula. Not a ton of options on the menu but that's because what there is is enough :-)  Check it out if you're in the neighborhood.
Love! Amazing quality of food, love the quaint ambiance and rustic decor, and the service is phenomenal! We will definitely be back! Perfect little spot for a date night! :) pizza was delish!

Checked this place out last night, and I thought it was great. Everyone who worked there was really nice, pizzas came out pretty quick, and food was great! Atmosphere was also really cute & the patio is decorated nicely.

Fantastic pizza spot.   I probably come here once a month when I'm up in the area.  Really nice owner and staff.  Usually sit at the bar and watch them fire up the pizzas.  Favorite pizza is the Carmela which has spinach, onions, and sausage.  Have tried many of their other pizzas as well and all have been delicious. Highly recommended!

Small and un-assuming.  The pizza is excellent if you like real Italian thin crust done in a real wood burning oven.  Slightly burnt crust, fluffy edge and chewy. Service is prompt and friendly. My wife and I shared one salad, which we thought was little small, however the lettuce was cold and didn't come out of a bag like many restaurants. They make their own sparkling water which came in a very cold bottle - a nice touch.  Wine selection is small, but reasonably priced. The patio is small, so get there early if you want to sit outside.  We will definitely go back!

Not sure if I'm too happy I order a pizza 37min before I arrive and the place is empty and they are just finishing making my pizza to put it in the oven? I sure hope it taste as good as the wait time?

Best wood fired pizza I've had by far. Love this place!! This place is tucked back on a side street and has quite a bit of outdoor seating. Being from North Dakota we took advantage of this and had our awesome pizza out on the patio. The owner came out and checked to see how we were doing. Super friendly guy and if I didn't say it already three times...this pizza is dope!! Highly highly recommend it!

Excellent.   Wife and I wanted to try something new. After seeing a good review for Il Bosco in an AZCentral story, we gave it a shot. It lived up to the hype. Great caprese, fried raviolis were excellent, and we got the Joanna pizza. Quality crust, good meat, nothing to complain about.   Bonus: they give you olives and great service.
A great little intimate spot and the pizzas are wonderful. Afterwards, ask for their homemade amaretto - spectacular.

Found this place after a quick scan of Yelp and we were very glad we did. Excellent food, service, and healthy wine pours...what more could you want? We started with the meatballs and they were phenomenal...a must try! After the first glass of wine was finished I ordered another and was pleasantly surprised to find around half a bottle in my glass, what service!! Finally, the main course arrived and the pizza was phenomenal. Crispy crust which you would expect at a wood fired pizza joint and the freshest ingredients. You can tell they really take pride in their food...   In summary, if you want pizza in the Scottsdale area look no further than il Bosco!!!

Ok, why is it that when it comes to writing REALLY good reviews, or REALLY bad reviews, I usually (not always) get it done straight away. But when it comes time to write the less than 5 star but more than 1 star review I procrastinate. In any case, here's my review of il Bosco, finally.   Where to begin, well, when you price your pizza in the same range as say Pizzeria Bianco, and you model your whole concept on them as well (more on this later), you better be phenomenal. But lamentably Il Bosco isn't phenomenal, theyre ok, the pizza is good, just not great. That said, the owner must have cajones the size of Texas to have priced his pizza in the same range as Chris Bianco's, or maybe its just his ego that's over inflated hence the over inflated price. As I've already said, its not bad, its just not $12-$15 per pizza great, the crust is good, but so delicate it cant handle a trip up the street a few blocks without completely collapsing into sogginess (I tried to take one home to my bro). I deduced that this must be the reason I saw 3 customers come in for take out and all of them had to wait as their pizza was cooked, after their arrival. They simply will not cook it until you are there to pick it up, which means you will always have a bit of a wait. We also had the meatballs al forno, which were not only small, but one of them was burnt, and I mean black spot burnt, but they served it to us anyway. Again, 2 of the 3 small meatballs were ok, they were good, but not, "hot damn I'm coming back here again soon" good, and the burnt one was not good at all of course. The caprese salad was probably the best thing we had there, but again, it was good, not great. The wine selection was decent, although I would say the reds are a better selection than the whites.   Now back to the afore mentioned similarities, like Biancos, Il Boscos menu features 2 salad choices, 2 small plate choices, and a variety of pizzas. Again just like Bianco's, they also offer house made mozzarella and bread, though the bread seems suspiciously dense, thick and un-Italian, not to mention nowhere in the vicinity of Bianco's quality either. This is where the menu similarities end though, Il Bosco offers 4 dessert options, but oddly, save for the the gelato, none of them are Italian, no tiramisu or cannoli here. Along with the gelato, a root beer float, brownies, and creme brulee are offered. What is a French dessert doing on the menu of a decidedly Italian restaurant (judging from the name Il Bosco which in Italian means woods or roughly forest)? Again, that suspiciously un-Italian vibe creeps up.
